She works as a hairdresser from her house, where she welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as hairdressing, make up, laser etc. She also owns a tattoo machine. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her inventory of new beauty products and hairdressing supplies. She wishes to earn a higher income to be able to expand her business operations and open her own hairdressing salon soon.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products and hair dressing supplies

loans.name: Leona

texts.en: Leona is 46 years old. Leona has been engaged in raising pigs as the main source of income for her family. Started with a sum of PHP 5,000, the business, through Leona's hard work and perseverance, today consists of two head of pigs and brings in about PHP 3,000 per month. With the goal of further developing her business, Leona is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. Leona plans to invest the income from the loan to further expand her business by increasing the number of pigs.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and feed for her business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en: Aireen is 31 years old and has one school-age child. She engages herself in selling SUNDANCE and MSE products to supplement her husband's income. She aims to improve the business and generate a higher income to satisfy their necessities. To work out her plan, she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of underwear, roll on, sandals, shoes, bags, pants, lotions and colognes to sell. She is hoping that someday, she will improve her business as well as their status of living as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy more stock of underwear, roll on, sandals, shoes, bags, pants, lotions and colognes to sell.

loans.name: Migna

texts.es:
Migna de 35 años , esta casada con  Vladimir y ambos tienen 2 hijos , Yoser de 14 años y John de 8 juntos viven en una vivienda construida a base de material noble la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación .Inicialmente como ama de casa opto por apoyar a su esposo en las diversas actividades agrícolas consistentes en la producción de cacao y café orgánico, actividad que con el tiempo fue adoptando hasta convertirla en el principal sustento de su economía familiar.
Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dirige a sus parcelas en donde desempeña diversas tareas junto a su esposo como deshierbo, deschuponado y abono de las plantaciones con el objetivo de obtener a fin de campaña una producción de calidad que le permita expender sus productos a buen precio.
Al hallarse  a mitad de la campaña productiva desea contar con capital de respaldo para proceder con el deschuponado y demás atenciones para sus cultivos .Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la compra de un vehiculo moto carguero con el cual espera reducir los costes de traslado para sus productos desde sus parcelas hasta los centros de acopio en su localidad.Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y contratar a trabajadores para proceder con el deschuponado de sus plantaciones así como realizar la compra de sacos de abono orgánico esperando optimizar su produccón.
texts.en:
Migna, 35, is married to Vladimir and together they have two children, Yoser, 14, and John, 8.  They live together in a house built of high-quality materials that's the fruit of their effort and dedication.  In the beginning, as a housewife, she decided to support her husband in various activities related to the production of cacao and organic coffee.  In time this became the main support of their family economy.

Very early every morning she goes to her plots of land where she does various tasks with her husband such as weeding, pruning, and fertilizing the crops with the goal of harvesting a high-quality crop that will allow her to sell her products for a good price.

It's the middle of the growing season and she wants to have support capital to continue with the pruning and other tasks for her crops.  Her long-term goal 
is to buy a cargo motorcycle with which she hopes to reduce transportation costs for her crops from her land to the distribution centers in her town.

Currently she needs to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to hire workers to continue pruning her farm and to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to optimize her production.

loans.use: to pay workers and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 49 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school and one of whom works. In 2010, he  opened a coffee shop in his town. He has loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy their free time. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l, which he will use to purchase needed products such as coffee and to renovate his café. This will increase the number of customers and, therefore, his revenue. One of his greatest dreams is to earn enough money to offer his children whatever they want. He also seeks cover his children’s study fees.

loans.use: to purchase needed products such as coffee and to renovate his café.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 42 years old. She lives in the small village of Martvili District with her four children. Several times, Tamar requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, Tamar has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, Tamar has a plot of agricultural land, where persimmon trees and nut trees are grown. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Tamar requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Tamar will buy clothing and dishes to sell. Tamar plans to buy at wholesale prices and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family and she will improve living conditions for her children. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and dishes to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 29 years old and married with one daughter. She lives in the village of Pilitan, Tumauini. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over eight years. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods for her business.

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en:
Kamleh is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. She works as a private teacher and has almost nine years of experience. She likes her occupation and wishes to help learners with getting the needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students. As for her husband, he has been working in a local company since 1990. 

Today, Kamleh is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate the teaching room at her house and equip it with the needed tools and supplies. She notes that these changes will increase her probability of receiving added students, therefore improving her income and thus, her way of life. She wishes to live a respectable life with her children; this is one of her greatest dreams.

loans.use: to renovate the teaching room at her house and equip it with the needed tools and supplies.

loans.name: Renalie

texts.en:
Renalie is 56 years old, married and has four children. 

Renalie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Renalie has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain her business.

In the future, Renalie would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 37-year-old business woman. She sells assorted goods. She is married to Afredo and they have six children. 

Irene has been selling the assorted goods for the past five years with a monthly income of PHP 8,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Irene will use the loan to purchase more products like coffee, creamer, milk and soap for her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to sustain her family financially and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more products like coffee, creamer, milk and soap for her business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa. Él se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado; por el momento solo tiene cinco animales. Su esposa se dedica a elaborar pan y venderlo. Ellos lastimosamente perdieron a su hijo y ella ha sufrido depresión; pero intenta reponerse. Él tiene más de quince años de trabajar con ganado; actualmente vende leche para obtener otros ingresos y comercializa con ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda que posee su esposa y para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para incrementar el numero de ganando que posee y aumentar la cantidad de leche. Su propósito es vender, queso, cuajada y crema; ya que por el momento solo vende leche.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 62 years old and lives with his wife.  He makes his living raising livestock; at the moment he only has five animals.  He has more than fifteen years of experience working with livestock; he currently sells their milk as another source of income.

His wife bakes and sells bread.  Sadly, they lost their son, which has been very painful, and his wife has suffered from depression, but she intends to recover and get back on her feet.  

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to pay off a debt that his wife currently has and to buy two dairy cows so that he can add to his herd of cattle and increase his milk production.

His goal is to sell cheese, curd and cream; at the moment he only sells milk.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that his wife currently has and to buy two dairy cows so that he can add to his herd of cattle and increase his milk production.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more sacks of rice, hence generating more income. She is in this business for four years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. Right now, she also has a variety store which is where she is more focused.

She would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy more sacks of rice. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margarita dreams that her businesses will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina de 30 años se encuentra casada con Fortunato de 33 años y con ellos un gran motivo de vida que es su pequeña Paula de 8 añitos.Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble que es producto de muchos años de trabajo.Es productora de cacao orgánico ya que desde niña apoyo a sus padres y con el paso de los años heredó una de sus parcelas.
Su labor la desempeña con el apoyo de su esposo  con quien viene llevando a cabo su campaña productiva y contando en ocasiones con la colaboración de trabajadores para tareas complicadas o colectivas.
En esta ocasión acude a MFP porque tiene un problema de salud la cual le impide desempeñar sus labores con normalidad y por esta razón requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y solventar los gastos de los exámenes de salud para luego reiniciar sus actividades con total normalidad de la misma manera se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Paulina, 30, is married to Fortunato, 33.  A great motivation for them in their life is their little Paula, just eight years old.

Paulina has a house built of high-quality materials that's the product of many years of work.  She produces organic cacao because she helped her parents since she was a little girl, and in time she inherited one of their plots of land.

She does her job with the help of her husband, with whom she is carrying out the growing season.  Sometimes she has the help of workers for complicated or collective jobs.

Currently she's going to MFP because she has a health problem that prevents her from carrying out her job normally.  This is why she needs 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN], to pay for health tests so she can then get back to her normal work.

She also pledges to make her payments punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
This is Nelita. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelita dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will always be full of joy and good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  That is also where she can  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Afiwavi est âgée de 46ans. Elle est mariée à un assistant médical et ils ont 04 enfants. Le premier est âgé de 23ans et le dernier 13ans. Les deux derniers seuls sont scolarisés. A la fin de sa formation de couture, elle a ouvert un atelier à domicile depuis 1986. Aidée par deux personnes, elle vend en plus de son activité des pagnes, et des matériels de couture (fermeture, tissus, ruban…). Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite de WAGES, elle voudrait s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a pour idée d’ouvrir un atelier de couture et bien entretenir la famille.
texts.en:
Afiwavi is 46 years old. She is married to a physician's assistant and they have four children. The eldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 13. Only the two youngest children attend school. After her fashion design training, Afiwavi has been running a studio at home since 1986. Assisted by two people, she sells pagnes [traditional cloth] and sewing accessories (clasps, fabric, ribbons, etc.), in addition to her business.

With this first loan she is seeking from WAGES, Afiwavi would like to purchase supplies in order to better meet her customers' needs. She is thinking of opening a sewing shop to better look after her family.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes [traditional cloth] and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Aida engages in vegetable vending and selling of AVON products in their community to supplement her husband's income. She is 55 years old and has only one child. She aims to improve and strengthen the business to generate sufficient income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more okra, tomatoes, bitter melon, ginger, onions and also AVON products to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more okra, tomatoes, bitter melon, ginger, onions and AVON products to sell

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
This is Marylen, 37, She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marylen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marylen hopes to give her children a good life and a future and dreams for an expansion in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 44 años y esta casado con Lourdes de 37 años, es padre de 5 hijos a quienes brinda una educación digna, actualmente posee una vivienda construida a base de madera en donde comparte a diario sus vivencias familiares.Al cumplir la mayoría de edad se inicio como jornalero en la producción de cacao, achiote y barbasco para posteriormente comprar su propia parcela convirtiéndolo con el paso de los años en una buena fuente de ingresos económicos para el desarrollo de su familia.
Para las diversas tareas de rutina concernientes a su labor siempre tiene el apoyo de su esposa, contando en más de una ocasión con el apoyo de trabajadores que se dedican a las labores complicadas y colectivas.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que gracias a ello viene sacando adelante a su familia. No obstante admite que la temporada de lluvias dificulta el normal desempeño de sus labores.
Su plan a largo plazo es de aperturar un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes en donde espera ocupar a su pareja y obtener ingresos extras . Desea contar en esta ocasión con 2,000 nuevos soles  para la contrata de trabajadores y proceder con el segundo deshierbo de campaña y la compra de sacos con abono orgánico para optimizar su producción a fin de campaña.
texts.en: Rubén is a 44-year-old man who is married to Lourdes, who is 37. He is a father of five children, and he is providing them with a good education. He currently lives with his family in a house built of wood. When he reached adulthood, he began working as a laborer in the production of the crops cacao, achiote and barbasco, so that he could eventually buy his own parcel of land, which over the years he has turned into a good source of income to support his family. For the routine tasks of his work, he always has the support of his wife. On occasion, he needs the help of laborers to perform more complex and intensive tasks. He is grateful to have his work, since thanks to this he has been able to provide a better life for his family. However, he admits that the rainy season makes it more difficult to perform his work. His long-term plan is to open a grocery store in which his wife can work and make extra income. On this occasion he is seeking 2,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers and proceed with the second weeding operation of the season. He will also buy bags of organic fertilizer so that he can optimize his production and obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to pay laborers and buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a mother who aims to become financially stable in order to give her children a bright future. She is 46 years old and has four school-age children. She and her husband aim to educate their children so that they will become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she engages in the cooking and selling of snack foods and cooked viands (meals) in the local community. She aims to cook more recipes to sell but she does not have enough capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, meat, vegetables, fish and seasonings to cook and sell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, meat, vegetables, fish and seasonings to cook and sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida's previous loans helped her a lot in her business and family expenses. She is very thankful that  for five years her business is continuously growing. Most of her children are already working. Since the death of her husband, she has worked harder to earn money for her family's future.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida dreams that her tailoring business will grow stronger and hopes that her family will always stick together. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en: Benjie, 28 years old, is a single man from the village of Ragan Sur. Benjie is engaged in repairing cellphones. His shop is located in the town of Tumuini in the province of Isabela. Being a single man, he helps his parents with their daily needs. Benjie is starting to save for his future family. He wishes that someday his business will expand so that he can provide a good living for his parents.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cellphones

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 53 years old. She has five children. She works selling rice in the community. Her sales depot is located in their house. She is going to use this loan to buy a sack of rice for her business. Milagros is a very hard-working person who is happy to have this opportunity since it helps her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice for her business

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para tener la tienda mas surtida de mercadería de primera necesidad, se comprar productos de la canasta básica, azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, sal, entre otros, que le darán una mejor atención para los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ella aumento su inventario de productos domésticos, sus ingresos han sido mejor con el negocio más surtido, sus necesidades básicas en la familia las ha cubierto, están muy bien de salud y con un negocio que cada día velara por surtirlo.
texts.en:
Patricia has decided to seek a new loan in order to restock her store with groceries.  She will buy basic household items such as sugar, rice, oil, soap and salt.  This will help her to provide enhanced service to her customers.

With her previous loan she increased her inventory of domestic products, and her income has been better with the store more fully stocked.  She is able to meet her family's basic expenses.  She is in very good health, and she looks after the business every day to keep it stocked.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, soap, salt and other items.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children in the capital city of Georgia. Ekaterine requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Ekaterine works as a housekeeper and earns a monthly income of 300 Laris per month. This is the only source of income for the family and it is hardly enough to pay for their food. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Ekaterine has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” on account of their low incomes. With the loan, Ekaterine will start a clothing business. She plans to purchase clothing in Turkey at wholesale prices and then resell the clothes to her neighbors at higher prices. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, could significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a retail clothing business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 22,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela hopes to have another business like a meat shop and dreams of having a vacation with her husband. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she draws strength from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Carolina Concepcion

texts.es:
Carolina, se decidió por continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, comprándose carne, maíz, bebidas, quesillo, gas, leña y tambien sillas para atender a los clientes, este financiamiento le ayudara para que Carolina pueda seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas y de pizza.
Ella comenta que su experiencia con el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener una mejoría en su producción, ya que así ha atendido a mas clientes, en su familia sus condiciones se mantienen.
texts.en: Carolina has decided to keep investing in her business, and she plans to buy meat, corn, cheese-filled tortillas, beverages, gas and firewood, as well as chairs for her customers. This loan will help her to continue in her business making pupusas and pizza. She reports that with her previous loan she was able to increase her inventory and her production, and as a result she was able to serve more customers. She has been able to maintain her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, cheese-filled tortillas, beverages, gas and firewood.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
Arcadio is 58 years old, married and has three children. He is raising hogs to sell for a profit. He usually earns about P2,000 for each hog disposed of. He had been in his business for six years now. 

Arcadio is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy feed for his hogs' sustenance. This will help nourish the hogs and  let them attain the desired weight so he can sell them at a profit, leading to good income in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs' sustenance

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 44 years old, married and has six children. Her spouse is a 'tricycle' driver. To add to her spouse's income, she sells dried fish to the people in her village. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis and earns P8,000 monthly. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. 

Erlinda hopes to keep achieving good sales from her business and earn good profits for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna accessed a previous loan, which helped a lot in her business and family needs. While her husband works as a mechanic, she is in the beauty  parlor doing her thing. She's been in this business for five years now and it keeps on growing.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy new equipment and materials needed for her salon. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes that her business will continue to grow and she dreams of giving her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and products needed for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years of age, married, and has eight children. Her priority in life is for her children to have a better future. Her only way to achieve her goal is by striving, continuing to operate her business, and sending her children to school through college so that they can become professionals someday. 

Agnes does not have any treasure to bequeath to her children; an education is all that she can give them. She hopes to grow her business in order to be able to realize her dream.  

Agnes raises ducks in her village. She sells eggs and and balut when her ducks produce eggs. Agnes has been in this business for almost 16 years. She sells her produce at wholesale prices to the vendors in the market. Agnes wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy feed to maintain her ducks.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old, married, with two children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

Edith owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over six years and earns PHP 6,000 every month. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009. 

Now, Edith has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se decidió por solicitar nuevamente  un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y aumentar con esto su buen servicio a los clientes, él comprara repuestos, manecillas, frenos, aceite, esto le ayudara para que Juan pueda realizar su trabajo sin mayores dificultades.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que su negocio aumento sus servicio a los clientes, esto le ha permitido que su clientela este satisfecha, ya que adquirió mas herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to seek a new loan to purchase supplies so that he can expand on the good service that he offers to his clients.  He will buy motor oil, brake levers, brake pads and other parts.  This will enable him to perform his work without major difficulties.

As a result of his previous loan he feels that he was able to improve his service to his customers, since he was able to buy more tools and spare parts to help him perform his job.  His customers have been very satisfied with his work.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, brake levers, brake pads and other parts.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir invirtiendo en cerdos, comprando 5, esto le ayudara para seguir comercializando los cerdos, espera realizar una buena inversión.
El comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar sus ventas, ya que realizo una buena compra, tener mejores ingresos para cambiar sus circunstancias familiares poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mauricio has decided to apply for a new loan so that he can continue to invest in pigs.  This time he plans to buy five pigs.  This will help him to continue selling pigs, and he hopes to get a good return on his investment.

He reports that with his previous loan he was able to increase his sales, since he made a good purchase. This helps him to improve his family's circumstances little by little.

loans.use: to buy five pigs.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida de 34 años , es soltera y tiene un niño de 12 años.Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de adobe y se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico en su localidad. Por el momento desempeña su trabajo con el alquiler de parcelas para justamente estar el pendiente de los árboles cacaoteros cuyo fruto requiere toda la atención del caso para obtener a fin de campaña frutos de calidad y venderlos a buen precio.
En mas de una ocasión de campaña convoca a trabajadores quienes la apoyan principalmente en las actividades de deshierbo debido a ser muy forzosa y necesaria para permitir que los nutrientes del suelo sean totalmente consumidos por los árboles de cacao y no por la mala hierba abundante en suelos tropicales.
Para esta ocasión solicita 1,000 nuevos soles para proceder con la compra de abono orgánico que es indispensable para optimizar la calidad de sus mazorcas de cacao .Sus planes a largo plazo apuntan a la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando así mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Nélida, 34, is single and has one 12-year-old son. She owns a home made of adobe. She works in the production of organic cocoa in her town. At the moment, she rents out plots of land in order to keep watch over the cocoa trees, whose fruit needs plenty of attention in order to end the season with fruit of good quality that she can sell at a good price.

On more than one occasion, she has hired workers to support her. They mainly help with the weeding, because it is very much necessary in order to allow the nutrients from the soil to be completely consumed by the cocoa trees, rather than by the abundant weeds in the tropical soil.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to continue buying organic fertilizer, which is indispensable in optimizing the quality of her cocoa pods. Her long-term plans are to build her home with good-quality materials, which she hopes will improve her quality of life and that of her young son.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maira Marisa

texts.es:
Maira, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para continuar invirtiendo aun mas en el negocio, se comprara maíz, sal, aceite, leña, quesillo, repollo, gaseosas y otros productos que sean necesarios para que el negocio pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar su condición, crecer y tener los materiales necesarios para trabajar, en su familia considera que su situación ha mejorado teniendo más ingresos.
texts.en:
Maira is seeking a new loan so that she can continue to invest in her business.  She will buy corn, cabbage, cheese-filled tortillas, salt, oil, soft drinks, firewood and other items so that she can continue to provide good service to her customers.

She reports that her previous loan helped her to expand her business and have all the materials that she needs.  She feels that her family situation has improved as a result of her increased income.

loans.use: to buy corn, cabbage, cheese-filled tortillas, salt, oil, soft drinks and firewood.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Due to financial constraints, Rosana engages in the planting and selling of vegetables in her community to generate income. She is 35 years old and has three school-age children. She aims to make the business profitable in order to continue sending her children to school. To improve her business, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 8,000.00 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. She believes that she will be improving her vegetable production business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Sarai Del Transito

texts.es:
Sarai, vive con su familia, se dedica a la venta de panes, su horario es de 6:00 am a 6:00pm. La venta la realiza con panes de pollo, salchichas, carnes, mortadela, y bebidas, realiza la venta de lunes a domingo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como pollo, carne, condimentos, y demás productos para la elaboración de la venta, esto mejorara su atención a la clientela, para poder mejorar su economía.
La aspiración de ella es que con su negocio pueda ayudar a la salud de su madre, quien padece de diabetes, del negocio compra medicamentos para mantenerla estable.
texts.en:
Sarai lives with her family and has a business selling sandwiches made with chicken, sausage, mortadela and other meats, along with drinks.  She works every day of the week from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy items such as meat, chicken and condiments for her business. This will allow her to provide enhanced service to her customers, which will in turn help her to improve her own financial situation.

Her goal is to be able to help her mother, who is suffering from diabetes.  With her earnings she will purchase medicines to help maintain her mother's health.

loans.use: to buy products such as meat, chicken and condiments.

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es:
Jorge de 41 años de edad, padre de tres hijos de 18,15 y 8 años de edad, es originario de la comarca Palo Verde, es las afuera de Estelí, lugar muy caracterizado por sus suelos fértiles y aptos para siembra de hortalizas. Él se dedica a sembrar tomates,  chiltomas, cebollas desde muy joven aprendió este oficio pues sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo.  Gracias a este negocio mantiene a su familia, sus hijos están estudiando pues desea que ellos tengan un mejor futuro.  
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, gasolina para la bomba de riego y pago de mano de obra para sembrar media manzana de tomates. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar mas tierra para ampliar el cultivo de hortalizas y adquirir compra de equipos agrícolas que le ayuden a agilizar sus labores de siembra.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41, is the father of three children, ages 8, 15, and 18. He is from the region of Palo Verde, in the outskirts of Estelí. This area is characterized by fertile lands which are suitable for growing vegetables. 

He makes a living planting tomatoes, sweet peppers, and onions, which he learned to do when he was very young because his parents did the same work. Thanks to this business, he is able to maintain his family. His children are studying and he hopes that they can have a better future.

He needs this loan to buy manure, fertilizers, insecticides, and gas for his irrigation pump, and to pay labor costs to plant half a block of tomatoes. One of his plans for the future is to buy more land in order to increase his cultivation of vegetables and to buy agricultural equipment that will help him to accelerate the farm labor.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticides, and gas for his irrigation pump, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: El Molino Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Molino” está ubicado en una comunidad pequeña donde las personas se conocen muy bien. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque se reunían en la casa de Doña Lucia quien tenía un molino de nixtamal y fue como se les ocurrió ponerle así. Doña Lucy, como le dicen de cariño, cuenta que tiene 42 años de edad está casada desde hace 22 años  con el señor Margarito juntos formaron una familia con cinco hijos y solo una de sus hijas se encuentra estudiando y que aun es dependiente de dicha pareja y sus cuatro hijos son ya independientes. Doña Lucy es una mujer muy entusiasta, alegre pero sobretodo muy trabajadora ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, bueyes, pollos, guajolotes y patos desde hace 22 años justo cuando se caso con el señor  Margarito. Doña Lucy cuenta que inicio su actividad porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar  y mas motivada se vio cuando la institución le ofreció el crédito y le comentaron que era para invertirlo en sus animalitos. Ahora esta solicitando un crédito para comprar más cerdos y becerros, platica que no tiene ninguna dificultad porque ya tiene mucha experiencia con los animales ha recibido dos capacitaciones para la cria de sus animales una por parte de la institución y otra por parte del gobierno, la señora Lucy comento: “Me gusta mucho mi actividad porque veo como nacen los animalitos bebes de sus madres, Una vez llegamos a tener una borrega que nos dio gemelitos solo que no podia tenerlos y tuvimos que ayudarla con las técnicas que aprendimos en las capacitaciones” Doña Lucy esta muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund porque gracias a los créditos que le han otorgado ella ha podido invertir en sus animales y con sus ganancias ha podido terminar de construir su casa, su vivienda solo tenía dos cuarto pero ahora ya cuenta con cuatro habitaciones y una sala chica pero también le ha ayudado a darle estudios a sus hijos. Sin embargo aun tiene el sueño de que su hija que se encuentra estudiando termine una carrera profesional y tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Las integrantes del grupo también están muy agradecidas con VisionFund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado ya que será de gran ayuda para invertir en sus actividades como Doña Maximina invertirá en bordados, pescados y pollos para su venta, Doña Nicolasa invertirá en borregos y maíz, Rosaura invertirá en ropa y María Cruz invertirá en la tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The "El Molino" ("The Mill") group is located in a small community where everyone knows each other very well. They chose this name because they meet in Lucia's house, and she has a corn mill, which is why they thought of naming their group this way.

Lucy, as she is affectionately called, is 42 and has been married to Margarito for 22 years. Together they formed a family with five children. Only one of their daughters is still studying and therefore dependent on them; the other four children are already independent. Lucy is a very enthusiastic and happy woman, but above all she is very hardworking. 

She has made a living raising pigs, oxen, chickens, turkeys, and ducks for 22 years, since she married Margarito. Lucy says that she started this business because she wanted to help her husband with their household costs. She became even more motivated when the institution offered her a loan, which they said was to invest in her animals. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more pigs and calves. 

She says that she doesn't have any difficulties in her work, because she already has plenty of experience with the animals. She has received two training sessions about raising animals, one from the institution and one from the government. Lucy said: "I like my work very much because I can see how the mothers give birth to their baby animals. Once we had a sheep who gave us twins, but she wasn't able to give birth to them and we had to help her with the techniques we learned in the training." 

Lucy is very happy and grateful to VisionFund because thanks to the loans, she has been able to invest in her animals. With her earnings, she has been able to finish building her house. Her house only had two rooms, but now it has four rooms and a small living room. This has also helped her to give her children an education. However, she still has the dream that her daughter who is still studying can finish a professional degree and have a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are also very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for this loan, because it will be a great help to them to invest in their businesses. Maximina will invest in embroidery, seafood and chicken to sell, Nicolasa will invest in sheep and corn, Rosaura will invest in clothing, and María Cruz will invest in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and calves.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed things for the generator and its maintenance. She has been in this business for eight years now. She and her husband, who is a mechanic, work hard to provide for their family. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and generator parts needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lydia dreams to give her children a good life and a future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and generator parts needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a la crianza de pollos, en esta actividad lleva ocho años desempeñándola y ha identificado que le genera muy buenas ganancias.  Con las que le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y estudio de sus hijos. Los insumos que necesita para sus actividades las compra en una ciudad que esta a cinco kilómetros de su casa, el transporte es escaso, por lo que debe esperar por horas que pase un autobús o caminar dos kilómetros aproximadamente. Luego debe trasportar los insumos en su espalda hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una incubadora y depositar ahí los huevos para aumentar el número de pollos rápidamente, obteniendo los ingresos de forma más rápida también.
texts.en:
Ruth, 33, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She is responsible for the household duties, and she has also raised chickens for eight years. She has found that it brings her a good income, which allows her to help her husband with the expenses of their household and their children's education. 

She buys the supplies she needs for her business in a city five kilometers away from her house. Transportation is scarce, so she either has to wait for hours until a bus comes or walk approximately two kilometers. Afterwards, she has to transport the supplies on her back on the way home.

She has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy an incubator where she can keep eggs in order to rapidly increase the number of chickens, which will in turn help her to earn an income more quickly as well.

loans.use: to buy an incubator where she can keep eggs to rapidly increase the number of chickens, which will allow her to earn an income more quickly.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 46 años, esta casada con  Mario de 50 años y juntos tienen 4 hijos  quienes son su motivación de trabajo.Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe la cual espera mejorar con el fruto de su trabajo.Estuvo siempre ligada a las actividades agricolas concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico  ya que desde niña creció trabajando en las parcelas de sus padres .Con el paso de los años y al alcanzar la mayoría de edad heredo una parcela con el objetivo de que al lado de su esposo pudieran sacar adelante a su familia .Su labor principalmente consiste en mantener sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico a base de una serie de tareas para optimizar su producción final , la cual se inicia con el reemplazo de plantaciones antiguas a través de una técnica denominada injerto hasta aplicar abono orgánico que ayuda a brindar mejores nutrientes los cuales se ven reflejados en las mazorcas que finalmente son vendidas a los compradores del lugar.
A manera de proceder con el primer deshierbo de campaña Zenaida desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y contratar trabajadores para el respectivo deshierbo de sus parcelas y asi continuar trabajando sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en: Zenaida is 46 and is married to Mario, who is 50. Together they have 4 children, who are their motivation for all their work. They live in a home built of adobe, which Zenaida hopes to improve with the fruits of her labor. She has always been involved in raising organic cacao, since from the time she was a girl she grew up working in her parents' parcels of land. As the years passed and she reached adulthood, she inherited a plot of land with the goal of working alongside her husband to provide a better life for their family. Their work consists primarily of maintaining their organic cacao crops, performing a series of tasks to optimize the final crop yield. The cycle starts with replacing the old plantings through a technique called grafting, which is followed by the application of organic fertilizer that helps to bring better nutrients to the plants. This is reflected in the quality of the final crops that are sold to buyers in the area. In order to proceed with the first weeding operation of the season, Zenaida is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers for this task. Once this is completed, she will be able to continue working without difficulty.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José, tiene un taller de refrigeración, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus tres hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, este negocio lo comenzó desde muy joven, ya que trabajo en un taller donde aprendió el oficio, trabaja junto con sus hijos, no tiene horario establecido.
El necesita realizar una inversión al negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar pinturas, lijas, macilla, gas, entre otros que son necesarios para la reparación de aires acondicionados, con esta inversión seguirá trabajando y atender a las clientes. 
La aspiración de José es mejorar el negocio, aumentar su número de clientes, darles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
José has a workshop where he repairs air conditioners. He lives with his family, made up of his wife and their three children. Everyone in his family works. He started this business at a very young age because he worked in a workshop where he was able to learn the business. He works alongside his children and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He needs to invest in his business, so he has applied for a loan which will allow him to buy paint, sandpaper, putty, and gas, among other supplies which are necessary to repair air conditioners. With this investment, he will continue working and serving his clients.

José's aspirations are to improve his business, to increase the number of clients, and to serve them better.

loans.use: to buy paint, sandpaper, putty, and gas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Tambulig, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been with her business for over six years and earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

Rosa joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010. Now, she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis, es agricultor y  transportista, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, solo él trabaja en el hogar, aprendió desde muy joven, ya que sus padres trabajaban en la agricultura, posee un camión con el que hace viajes, los cultivos los realizan en tierra alquilada, no tiene un horario establecido y cuenta con experiencia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros, que le ayuden a realizar un mejor trabajo en la siembra.
El objetivo de Luis es que su trabajo sea exitoso, ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente, a futuro comprarse su propios terrenos donde cultivar.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer and a trucker.  He lives with his wife and children.  He is the only one in his family who works outside the home.  He learned farming from a very early age, since his parents were also farmers.  He has a truck, with which he transports goods.  They plant their crops on rented land.  They don't follow an established schedule; instead they count on their own experience.

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.  These will help him to obtain better results.

His goal is to achieve success in his work, to help his children so that they are academically prepared, and in the future to buy his own land on which to raise his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Two years ago, when Victorina was asked her dream, she replied she wanted to finish giving her four children their college education and to have decent work. Now, she has successfully reached her dream by means of working hard. Victorina is in her sixties. She engages in a mini-grocery business in the market. 

At present, Victorina’s wish is to expand her business site to become a grocery store. Victorina is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy beverages, breads, and snacks to sell. She believes that the loan will serve as her first step in achieving her wish.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, and snacks to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
This is William, 56. He is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Soledad and is a father to their children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

William operates a tailoring business. He mainly offers curtains, bedsheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. He also does repairs and alterations. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in his business. 

William hopes that his business will grow larger and dreams to give his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion was working abroad for 10 years. When she went back to the Philippines, she started to put up a sari-sari store business in their village. Her business serves as her daily source of income for her family. Consolacion's husband is a farmer and they have two grown children.
Consolacion has been in her business for 13 years. Her earned profits are used to sustain her hogs with feed, as her additional source of income. Consolacion is requesting a loan of PHP50,000 to buy grocery items like canned goods, drinks and biscuits to sell. She wishes to thrive in her business as well as to prosper in her line of business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, drinks and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 39 years old, already widowed, and has two children. She stands as a mother and father of her two children. Being the head of the family, Visitacion needs to strive just to feed her children and attend to their needs. To make a living, Visitacion runs a sari-sari store business in their village. She sells a variety of goods to her customers.
Visitacion wants to extend the variety of products she sells to her customers. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy spices, powder for juice, beverages and condiments to sell. Visitacion wishes to generate a higher income to further sustain their needs and her children's allowances in school. Visitacion will look towards the success of her business and her success as a businesswoman as well.

loans.use: to buy spices, powder for juice, beverages and condiments to sell

loans.name: Emerita Alicia

texts.es:
Emérita, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito, para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso se comprara maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, leña para realizar la venta, con esta inversión su negocio estará estable por algún tiempo.
Con el préstamo anterior considera Emérita que ha mejorado el negocio, teniendo todo lo más necesario para realizar las pupusas, en su familia sus condiciones han cambiado, permaneciendo mejor que antes.
texts.en: Emérita is requesting another loan to continue investing in her business. She will buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, oil, and firewood for her stall. This investment will keep her business stable for a while. Emérita believes that the previous loan improved her business because she was able to buy everything necessary to make pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her home conditions have improved too.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, oil, and firewood to make traditional snacks to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
This is Ester, 48, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sandro, an electrician, and they have children together. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Ester operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Ester earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Ester dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like dresses for kids, polo shirts for men and women, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Claudia Clariza

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia vive en Libertad, tiene 40 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio en la ciudad de Guayaquil desde hace muchos años y desde que reside en Libertad sigue realizando su trabajo de venta de agua.
Ella es una mujer que realiza su negocio sola trabaja desde las 2:00 de la tarde hasta las 8:00 de la noche, tiene personas que le ayudan a vender.

La dificultad que tiene es el cambio de clima ya que si se encuentra en temporada de lluvias la venta es muy poca y no puede trabajar con facilidad. Es una mujer soltera, su esposo la abandono con sus dos hijos uno de 17 y el otro de 16 años de edad, que ambos estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar agua embotellada para vender a sus clientes. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda para así poder tener un local propio en donde pueda distribuir su mercadería y que se le facilite la movilización del producto. Y así tener más ganancias y brindarles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in Libertad, and is 40 years of age. She started her business in the city of Guayaquil many years ago, and ever since she moved to Libertad, she has continued to work selling water. She is a woman who runs her business alone, and works from 2 pm until 8 pm. She has three people who help her to make her sales. The difficulty that Claudia faces is the changing climate, as sales are very low during the rainy season and it’s not easy to work. 

Claudia is single, as her husband left her and her two children, aged 17 and 16. Both her children study in public school. With the loan she has requested, Claudia would like to buy bottled water to sell to her customers. Her dream is to improve her home, so that she can have her own premises from which to distribute her goods. This will also help her to move her products and have a higher income, providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy bottled water.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 42 años es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de superarse, esta casada con Julio con quien tiene 3 hijos y  vive junto a ellos en su casa propia .El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, razón por la cual visita a sus amigos , vecinos y conocidos  en busca de distintos pedidos tales como perfumes, ropas, joyas, etc. También realiza esta actividad desde su hogar ya que armo un pequeño stand en donde coloca todos los productos que tiene , ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su hija quien coloca alguno de los productos entre sus amistades , lleva ya mas de 3 años trabajando en esto y le va muy bien.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aporta en la economía de su hogar, espera poner mas adelante una pequeña pero muy surtida boutique en su hogar. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y tiene muchas expectativas para el futuro razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará productos por catalogo como perfumes, talcos, desodorantes,entre otros,ya que están en promoción y desea tenerlos en stock para asi poder maximizar su ganancia.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old and is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead in life. She is married to Julio, and they have three children. They all live together in the house that they own. Rosa sells cosmetics by catalog, visiting her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances to take orders for perfume, jewelry, and clothes. She does this from home too, where she had set up a stall displaying all the products that she has. Her daughter helps her out by selling some of the products to her friends. Rosa has been doing this for more than three years and the business is doing well. What she likes about her job is that it enables her to contribute towards the household income. In the future, she hopes to set up a small, well-stocked boutique in her house. This is her second Kiva loan, and she has many hopes for the future. For this reason, she pledges to be punctual with her loan repayments. With the requested amount of 1000 soles, Rosa will buy products by catalog such as perfumes, talcum powder, deodorants, etc. because they are on offer right now and she wants to have them in stock to be able to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old, married, and has children to educate. She buys dried fish and sells them to the people in her village. She usually earns P6,000 each month in her business. She hopes to increase her sales and earn more funds, and that is why she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more dried fish to re-sell for a profit.

Rosalina hopes to keep increasing her sales to earn more income and save funds for her family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to re-sell for a profit

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy con tan sólo 21 años de edad, se ha convertido en un gran ejemplo para sus familiares, amigos y vecinos de su localidad. A su corta edad, sueña no sólo con tener un negocio que le proporcione el sustento diario, si no en construir una microempresa que sea generadora de empleo y productividad. 
Aprendió el oficio de la fabricación de calzado gracias a su padre que se dedica a la misma labor.
En la actualidad, labora como independiente y vive con su madre, a quien sostiene debido a que tiene problemas de salud por lo cual requiere estar en constante tratamiento médico.
Su madre es la principal razón por la que esta joven  trabaja diariamente a fin de conseguir los ingresos necesarios para sostener el hogar y garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de materiales como cuero, hebillas, pegantes  con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción, sacar su negocio adelante y generar mejores condiciones económicas para su familia.
texts.en:
Cindy is only 21 years old, but has become a great example for her family, friends and neighbors in her town.  At her young age, she dreams not only of having a business to earn a daily income but also in building a small company that generates employment and productivity.  She learned how to make shoes from her father who is in the same trade.

Currently, she works independently and lives with her mother who has health problems and needs constant medical care.  Her mother is the main motivation for this young woman who works daily to make enough income to support the household and provide a better lifestyle.

She is now requesting a loan to buy materials such as leather, buckles, and glue to increase productivity, expand her business and give her family a better economic situation.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, buckles, and glue

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 37 years old, married, and has three children attending school. His children are all in the elementary level of education. Christopher is doing his best for the better future of his family. He is a farmer who grows rice in their village. Christopher shares that he did not succeed in farming for the previous season because of subsequent calamities. 

Christopher doesn’t want to end his line of business in that situation. Instead, he continues his journey and put up another business. Now, Christopher is also engaged in a bakery business in their village. As a start-up business, Christopher needs additional working capital for his business. He is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy flour, sugar and trays to use in making bread. Christopher wishes to succeed with his new business and manage it well for its future growth.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and trays to use in making bread.

loans.name: Bedri

texts.en:
Bedri wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to continue his business as a taxi driver. With the previous loan he paid to register his vehicle and he bought tires, which helped him to increase his business profit. Through these profits, Bedri helped his family to improve their life conditions. He is very satisfied with his business, and he plans to continue in the future. 

Bedri is requesting a second loan for his different business in agriculture. He has been in the agricultural business from tradition. He is in need of a 1,500 euro loan to buy another cow. 

Bedri is planning to increase the number of cows for selling milk and milk products in his area. Bedri is hoping to work as a taxi driver and also to keep cows for selling milk and milk products in the future.

The loan will help Bedri to generate more income and to provide a secure life for his family. He would like to thank again Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes and her family are forever grateful for how far the UGAFODE Micro finance has brought them. One of the daughters is awaiting her high school exams, and the other two are still in secondary school. The loan will help her pay tuition for her two daughters and buy their scholastic materials. This will enable her children to study well without the interruption of going back home to bring tuition. Agnes is a resilient and honest lady.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns and operates a catering service near U.C.C. in Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received a secondary school education. She is single and has no children. Elizabeth has been working as a caterer for some time now. She is responsible for supporting herself and paying all her own personal and business expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more supplies and ingredients necessary to operate her catering service. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her catering service to meet the needs of more customers.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and ingredients necessary to operate her catering service.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es: La señora vende sus producto en uno de los parques de la ciudad de chinandega desde hace  5 años tiene de ser  comerciante mas de 25 años, en su negocio vende producto de emergencias ya que ella administra tambien los baños sanitarios del parque ella aprovecha para vender productos de emergencias y visuterias, la señora es casada madre de 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella, antes de tener su negocio la señora era maestra pero y decidio de tener su negocio propio a la vez tambien la señora vende los dias 15 y 30 de cada mes fuera de chinandega vende ropa, botas de hule, y productos que le encargan los clientes de cosiguina y comarcas aledañas. la señora se siente muy bien con la institucion y los financiamientos que le han otorgado, ahora ella cuenta con un medio de transporte y su calidad de vida a mejorado.
texts.en: Maritza Isabel has sold her products in one of the parks in the city of Chinandega for five years. She has been a merchant for over 25 years. She sells basic necessities because she also manages the bathrooms in the park. She takes advantage of this by selling bathroom products and costume jewellery. She is a married mother of four. None of her children depend on her. Before having this business, she was a teacher, but she decided to start having her own business at the same time. On the 15th and 30th of every month she goes outside of Chinandega and sells clothing, rubber boots, and other items ordered by her customers in Cosiguina and the neighbouring area. She feels very comfortable with the institution and the loans that she has received. She now has a mode of transportation and her quality of life has improved.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: costume jewellery, toilet paper, diapers, feminine hygiene products.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 32-year-old man. He is married and has three children of his own but also takes care of his two younger brothers. He had to start taking care of his brothers after their parents passed away. Isaac works till 8PM every day. He serves ice cream to students, passengers in bus parks, and people in town.

This business has now run for about 15 years. The business challenges are load shedding, and, when it rains, he does not sell much. Isaac's dream is to register his business and to expand it.

Isaac has a small garden where he grows potatoes and corn, which helps him to get additional income. Isaac wants to buy ice cream cones, flavor, eggs, and other ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.use: to buy ice cream cones, flavor, and other ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La señora se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de chinandega desde hace 40 años, es un negocio familiar el cual ella empezo como ayudante de cocina de la mamá quien era la propietaria, ella estudiaba y cocinaba, decidio ahorrar para poner su propio negocio y lo comenzo con capital propio, en la actualidad ella vende sus comidas  y de esas ventas saca adelante a sus hijos los cuales son dos y dos nietos que dependen de ella, es soltera y madre y padre para sus hijos, labora de lunea a domingo desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la  tarde.

la señora se esfuerza por sacar adelante su hogar, es por ello que solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus alimentos para mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Eva has sold food in one of the Chinandega markets for 40 years. This is a family business, and she started off as a kitchen aid when her mother was the owner. Maria Eva studied and cooked in the business at that time. She decided to save up to open her own business and she opened it with her own capital. She sells food now and is able to support her two dependent children and two grandchildren with her income. She is single, and is both father and mother to her children. She works every day of the week from 5 am to 4 pm. She works hard to support her household. She is working hard to improve her home, and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains to improve her business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as: rice by the quintal, beans, oil by the drum, and vegetables.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus has run a retail store for two years. She is 25 years of age and married with two children. Venus aspires to have a stable source of income so she can give her children a quality education, support a comfortable lifestyle for them, and sustain their basic necessities. The couple both work hard to earn a living.

Venus would like to request a loan of 7,000 PHP, which allows her to buy stock for her retail store. She hopes for continuous access to financial assistance in order to fulfill her goal in life. Venus hopes for approval of her requested loan amount so she can continue to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon de 35 años de edad, asegura que su familia es el pilar y la base de la que se sostiene para luchar diariamente a fin de garantizarle una vida digna y sin necesidades.
Desde hace 10 años labora como independiente en la tienda que montó gracias al esfuerzo y la dedicación de  todo el conjunto familiar. Pues su esposa, después de realizar las labores domésticas se dirige al negocio a colaborarle con los pedidos y la clientela.
Su deseo de montar empresa surgió gracias a las vivencias de su infancia; desde que sus padres lo enviaban a pasar vacaciones a la casa de sus primos quienes tenían una tienda de alimentos, Jhon se enamoró de la actividad. Es así como su deseo de tener negocio propio se convirtió en su realidad. Hoy desea mejorar las instalaciones de su local, con el fin de hacerlo más agradable al público y aumentar la demanda de sus productos. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para mejorar la imagen. 
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia una vivienda propia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jhon is 35 years old. He ensures his family has a strong foundation, for which he fights daily so that they have a decent life and don't go without.  For the past ten years, he has worked independently in the store he built through hard work and the dedication of the whole family.  His wife, after completing the housework, heads over to the store to help with the orders and assist customers.
