He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his dispoable income for school fees and food. In the future, Jerryfanos plans to become an agro-dealer with his own hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy maize for grinding meal.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 27 years old. She lives in the Tkibuli District with her parents and sister. Khatia has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but has not had any success. Her loan requests have been rejected because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Khatia is currently working in a grocery shop as a seller and her father is an artisan working on private orders. They both have small monthly incomes, however these are not enough to support their family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khatia requested a loan from Credo to fund a start-up family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Khatia will rent a trading counter at the local market in the Tkibuli district, purchase clothes at wholesale price, and then sell them for retail price. Khatia will use the profits to reinvest in the same business. This new business initiative, financed by the Kiva start-up loan, will help this young girl start her own business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to rent a trading counter and purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44-year-old Eunice from Masvingo. She is married with four children. She also cares for three dependents. Eunice runs a retail business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge she faces is a shortage of feed, which results in a poor grade of chickens. 

Eunice has requested a loan of 200 USD to buy feed and chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life. In the future, Eunice plans to improve her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 42-year-old cloth seller. She resides at Glefe in the Dansoman community. She has been selling cloth for the past three years, and she is still doing very well. 

This is Cecilia's fourth loan with ID, and she needs 1,200 GHS to expand her business and buy more cloth to sell to her customers. Because of her continued association with ID, Cecilia has been able to rent an apartment at the market place.

loans.use: to buy more cloth.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 24-year-old ambitious young man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After failing to continue with his studies, he decided to venture into the transport business. He started as a hired driver, but, through hard work, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle and to buy land. He now wants to diversify his business and venture into housing, despite challenges of inadequate capital and the high cost of fuel. 

John dreams of owning a housing estate and buying buses. John intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as sand and bricks.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand and bricks.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 57 years old and lives in Zestafoni District with his retired mother Lali. Merab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Merab owns an agricultural plot of land where he has a vineyard and nut trees. Merab harvests grapes and nuts, makes wine and sells the products locally at the market. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Merab will purchase 500 chicks and chicken food, grow them and sell them at a profitable price locally in Zestaponi markets. Merab will use the profit to reinvest in the same business and in future he will also start selling eggs. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will give Merab chance to improve the living conditions and look after his aged mother.

loans.use: To purchase 500 chicks and chicken food

loans.name: Kubatana Gwamakunguvo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Tinashe from Masvingo. He is married and has two children. He also cares for one dependent. Tinashe is a grocer and sells a variety of food and household goods. The business has been in operation for one year. In his business, Tinashe faces challenges transporting his stock. 

Tinashe has requested a loan of 400 USD to replenish his stock. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase profits and save for a car. In the future, Tinashe plans to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mubende  in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, six currently in school. For the past three years, John has been working hard to manage his boutique, where he sells clothes . 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes and shoes and will help John generate greater profits and pay school fees for children. John hopes that in the future he will be able to see all of his children finish school. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare television parts and tools.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina from Amazing group. She is 34 years old and works as a seamstress. She has been doing this business for the past six years and is doing very well. 

In 2012, she was introduced to ID Ghana by her husband who had inquired about credit. She always tells people good things about ID Ghana and how it has helped her grow her small business. 

She is a committed and hardworking individual who is also innovative in all she does. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 1,000 to buy more products to satisfy her customers in the Bulemli community.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 65-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows crops and also rears cattle. He also has a produce business, and he gets the supplies directly from his farm. As a father, he wants to educate his children so they can attain degrees and venture into modernized agriculture. This will help them to weather challenges such as unpredictable weather changes and limited funds.

David says that his customers' needs sometimes require them to buy from other farmers. David intends to use the loan to buy Irish potatoes and sorghum so he can better meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Sacreet Heart Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44 year old Eunice from Mutare. She is widowed with three children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Eunice runs a retail business selling wooden spoons and plates to sell in South Africa. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are the long time it takes to renew her license for selling wooden products. Eunice has requested a loan of $900 to purchase wooden products for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Eunice plans to employ other people.

loans.use: To buy wooden products like spoons and plates to supply to South Africa

loans.name: Kunzwana Group

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aston from Masvingo. He is married and has four children, all attending school. He also cares for four dependents. Aston runs a poultry business. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of proper infrastructure to care for the chicks. 

Aston has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy feed and chicks. He says the extra income generated will go towards the upkeep of his family and payment of school fees. In the future, Aston plans to increase his poultry stock.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en:
Zipora is a 38-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Twelve years ago, she decided to venture into fish sales in order to raise income to support her family. She also grows crops to earn extra income. Lack of modern preservation equipment poses a challenge to her business, and her dream is to buy a refrigerated van.

Zipora intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio and his family are Peruvian craftspeople who specialize in colonial-style furniture. They would like to invest in the purchase of quality leather and wood to increase production.

Jose Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"My family and I have created carved wood furniture with tooled leather for several generations. We proudly follow the traditions, incorporating contemporary teachings and designs to face new challenges. Our creations are totally handmade with love and quality. For us, embossing leather is a family tradition. My father inherited it from his father, and handed it down to us. When he was very young, my father learned to work with leather, making saddles primarily for fine Peruvian paso horses. Later he established a small workshop, where he achieved such a perfection that soon his products, totally handmade, gained great acceptance and prestige.

"I would like to give you all a big hug for supporting our work. We've been losing [out] on sales for not having a good stock of products, so this microcredit will go towards buying enough materials that will enable us to craft a strong stock of your favorite leather furniture pieces. It's hard having your own business, but you make it easier. Thank you for your support and good will!"

Use the link below to view Jose Antonio's leather and wood furniture on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1411

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of quality leather and wood to increase production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in the art of arpilleria (appliqué). She would like to buy more fabric and other materials to increase production.
 
Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

"I joined a women's group to learn textile arts. At first, we'd create our patchwork wall hangings from old clothes. One day, with the little bit of money we each could contribute, we bought bolts of fabric and spools of yarn and thread. With these materials, we created our first pieces to sell. Today, my husband and son help me. I've taught them to help with the finishing of each piece. These days I realize that what I feel becomes a part of every tapestry where I depict my experiences – what I do in daily life."

"I would like to send you my most heartfelt thanks for this microcredit. It is very comforting to know that there is someone out there you can count on. This fills us with happiness and inspires us to keep working on quality products for you."

Use the link below to view Maria's arpilleria (appliqué) pieces on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6118

loans.use: to buy more fabric and other materials to increase production.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, está casado, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, él inicio el negocio de la ganadería como una fuente de ingreso para su hogar, el horario de trabajo es de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de novillas y chivos, los cuales alimentara y comercializa dentro de un tiempo, este préstamo le servirá para mejorar su negocio y tener una fuente de ganancia a futuro.
La aspiración de Wilfredo es con el negocio mejorar su condición de vida en la familia y a futuro adquirir un camión para trabajar con él.
texts.en:
Wilfredo works buying and selling cattle. He is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. He started his cattle business as a source of income for his household. His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy heifer cows and young goats, which he will fatten and sell after a while. This loan will be used for him to improve his business and to have a source of income in the future.

Wilfredo’s goal is, with the business, to improve his family’s living conditions, and in the future, to obtain a truck for his work.

loans.use: to purchase heifer cows and young goats.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 36 years old and married to Cecilia, a 28-year-old trader. They are blessed with four children. He sells fresh fish in the Glefe community and has been doing this for the past three years. He is still doing very well.

He joined ID Ghana in 2010. He is an innovative, very organized and hardworking individual who is also committed in all his dealings.

This is his fourth loan and he needs GHS 650 to buy more fish to satisfy his customers in the Glefe community.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Kumboedza Vutete Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 57-year-old Rossie from Masvingo with her hand raised. She is married with eight children, one attending school.  Rossie runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge she faces is the high demand for clothes she is failing to meet due to lack of finances. Rossie has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will increase her disposable income which will help to improve the quality of life of her family. In the future, Rossie plans to own a clothing shop and sew clothes in that shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 49 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, three currently in school. For the past 10 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his medical center, which carries out blood tests . 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy supplies such as a lab machine for the center and will help Francis generate greater profits and care for his family. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the center . 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as a lab machine for the center

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 49-year-old single woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a natural resource officer, and she gets a hard-to-reach allowance as side income. She has been in this service for four years, and with the proceeds, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University. Justine intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dan Group

texts.en:
The group is made of two partners; namely, Daneil and Abena. Both of them reside in Glefe in Dansoman. They have been a group since 2011 to present and are doing very well. Both sell foot wear (shoes and sandals) and bags.

Daneil is a 45-year-old footwear seller. This has been his business for the past two years and it is doing very well. 

Because of his integrity and frankness, all his customers have him at heart. He has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and still loves to be a part of our organization for all of his life. He has taken three loans and has fully repaid all of them.  

For his fourth loan, he is requesting GHS 1,400 to help him meet his customers demands. The entire group needs an amount of GHS 2,000 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around Dansoman.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ndanaiya Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ndanaiya” group from Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of  700,000 Leones for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Safea is the leader of this group. The 25-year-old is single with two children who are attending primary school. Safea has been a businessman for six years now. He sells belts, glasses, mobile phones, batteries, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items on a wholesale basis to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy belts, glasses, mobile phones, batteries, etc., on a wholesale basis to add to his current ones.

loans.name: God In Blessing Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “God In Blessing” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 600,000.00 Leones for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Mary is the leader of this group. The 46-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children -- two in primary school and three in secondary school. Mary has been a businesswoman for eight years now; she sells medicines. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of medicines to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of medicines to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood and charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a married man from Rafah city. He is a father with six sons. 

For the past seven years, Emad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Emad is requesting a $1,200 USD loan from FATEN to cover the maintenance expenses for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Emad to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Emad appears in the photo beside his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance expenses for his taxi.

loans.name: Vero Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three members: Veronica, Mary, and Elizabeth. They sell clothes and second hand clothes. They reside in Soko in the Dansoman community. They have been together from 2012 to date.

Veronica is a 53-year-old clothes seller and married to Victus a 55-year-old trader. They have two children to the glory of the Lord. She has been with ID Ghana for the past one year and she is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for four years now. She works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is her second loan; she needs an amount of GHS 500 to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana for its support so far. 

Veronica, Mary, and Elizabeth need a total amount of GHS 1,700 to buy more clothes to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mo Mary Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of four members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2011. They are Mary, Edith, Comfort, and Rosemary. Edith and Comfort sell bags, Rosemary sells cooking utensils, and Mary sells drugs. They all reside at the Banana Inn in the Dansoman community.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Mary is a 41-year-old chemical drug seller. She has 12 years of experience. She works six days-a-week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. 

This is her fifth loan with ID-Ghana; she is requesting an amount of GHS 2,000 to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 4,000 for business expansion and meeting their customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy more medical drugs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sueamaya Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the Sueamaya Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 700,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. Elizabeth is 40-years-old; she is married with five children – two in primary school, two in secondary and one who is not of school-going age. Elizabeth sells cigarettes, drinks, mints, chewing gums, etc. She has been doing business for six years now. With the help of this loan, Elizabeth will invest in her business by buying cigarettes, drinks, mints, chewing gums, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, drinks, mints, chewing gums, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Oneness group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Patrick. Patrick is 32; he was born in Tankoro in eastern Sierra Leone, but he is currently residing in Koidu together with his wife and child. His child is a primary school pupil. Patrick has been a businessman for 10 years now. He sells belts, caps, etc. Patrick would like to use his share of this loan to further expand his business. He will use it to buy belts, caps, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy belts, caps, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Leh We Hold Fine Group

texts.en: Sia is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sia was born in a place call Sowa, in eastern Sierra Leone 28 years ago. She is married with four children; two are in primary school and two are in secondary school. For five years now, Sia has been selling biscuits, cigarettes, milk, sugar, butter, etc. This is not the first loan that Sia and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Sia will use her share of the loan to expand her business, she will buy biscuits, cigarettes, milk, sugar, butter, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, cigarettes, milk, sugar, butter, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sorry Heart Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Sorry Heart II Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kumba. Kumba is 38; she was born in Kono. Kumba is married to a diamond miner and the couple has five children - one is attending primary school and four are in secondary school. For 10 years now, Kumba has been selling market food - rice, palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. With this loan, Kumba will buy rice, palm-oil, salt, margi, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

(Also attached on the right of the photo is a member of the group who was not present for a group snap shot).

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, salt, margi, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Tayorma Group

texts.en: Dora is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Dora was born in Nimikoro, in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. She is 53 years of age. Dora is married to a farmer and the couple has eight children; two of whom are still attending school. For over 21 years now, Dora has been selling bowls, buckets, plates, etc. This is not the first loan that Dora and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently further improve their living conditions. Dora will use her share of the loan to buy a larger quantity of the above mentioned items to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: to buy bowls, buckets, plates, etc. in larger quantity to add to her existing stock.

loans.name: Favour Group

texts.en:
Yei is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yei was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone 35 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Yei sells market food such as: rice, palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has been doing this business for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Yei and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Yei will use her share of the loan to buy rice, palm-oil, salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
AWA est née vers 1956 à Tougan (BURKINA FASO), elle réside avec ses cinq enfants  à NIMBOUGOU dans la concession de son défunt mari, cercle de KADIOLO (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
AWA est une matrône de son état et une veuve qui fait le commerce de pagnes wax  et de tasses il y’a plus de 25 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille à NIMBOUGOU et à LOULOUNI ville où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits et de sa crédibilité. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis près de 5 ans, elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte achéter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques douzaines de tasses auprès des grossistes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA dont  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et l’autre partie sera épargnée.
Elle ambitionne d’acheter quelques bétails et de construire quelques chambres dans sa cours.
texts.en:
Awa was born around 1956 in Tougan (Burkina Faso), She lives with her ​​five children in the concession belonging to her late husband, located in Nimbougou, part of the Kadiolo subdivision (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Awa is a trained midwife and a widow who has been trading pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and cups for over 25 years. She pursues her activities in her family in Nimbougou and in Loulouni, city where she is much sought after by her clients for the quality of her products and her credibility.

To satisfy her increasing number of customers she joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution almost 5 years ago, She is on her third individual loan cycle. Previous loans have been fully repaid.

She intends to buy 10 pieces of pagne wax and a few dozen cups from wholesalers.

With this loan she expects an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA part of which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and the other part will be put into savings.

Her ambition is to buy some cattle and build a few rooms in her courtyard.

loans.use: Buy pagnes and cups

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Minerva Group

texts.es:
La señora Elda Lilia es casada tiene 37 años de edad, ella curso el 5to. año de educacion primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa americana; inicio este negocio cuando una amiga le concedio un saldo de Q.500.00 de ropa para que los vendiera. Hasta la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia en dicho negocio, tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas.

Organiza un Grupo para solicitasr un prestamo, que lo utilizará para la compra de ropa americana para vender. Ella en el futuro quiere ver su negocio prosperado y asi poder ayudar de mejor manera a su familia. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa, tambien a la ventas de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Elda Lilia, 37, is married and has a 5th grade education.  She buys and sells American clothing, and began her business when a friend gave her GTQ 500 worth of clothing to sell.  She has been in business for eight years and is supported by her husband who is a metal structure worker.

She has organized a group to request the loan, which she will use to buy American clothing to sell.  In the future, she hopes to see her business prosper so she can better help her family.  The other members of the group buy and sell clothing as well as daily consumption products.

loans.use: To buy American clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bankoama Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the Bankoama Group from Koidu, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kumba is the featured leader of this group. The 27-year-old is married to a trader and they have six children. Kumba has been a businesswoman for four years now, she sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) rice, flour, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy margi, rice, flour, sugar, etc. in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena a sus 65 años de edad con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, ella es propietaria de un negocio ambulante de Mercadería en general ósea venta de ropa nueva, prendas de oro,  plata, laminado, calzados entre otros, ella riega de manera ambulante sus clientes son habitantes de comarcas del municipio de Chinandega, negocio que posee desde hace varios años el cual poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante, ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora que ha logrado darles sus estudios a sus hijos, con mucho esfuerzo, Ivania esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de  diversas variedad de ropa como: zapatos, ropa de niño, damas, faldas, cosméticos , prendas de oro entre otros. Ella está muy agradecida con el apoyo que les han brindado los inversionistas Kivas a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Ivania Azucena, 65, has five adult children and she runs a business selling general merchandise, including new clothing, gold and silver lamé items, shoes, etc.  She works as a street peddlar in her town of Chinandega and has been in business several years, getting ahead little by little.  She has always struggled hard to be able to provide her children with an education.

Ivania is requesting a loan to buy different clothing such as shoes, children's clothing, women's skirts, cosmetics, gold lamé, etc.  She is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders give low-income communities.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, skirts, blouses, shoes, gold and silver lamés, etc.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwamini est conseillère du groupe Asifiwe, mariée, jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 29 et mère de 4 enfants. Sont mari est un fonctionnaire. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme au marché Nyabushongo. Elle commença son affaire avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 20 cycles de crédit dans ce programme de microfinance.  Grace, à ce programme, elle a déjà réaliser plusieurs petits projets pour sa famille dit-elle. Ce nouveau prêt va lui server d’acheter 7 futs d’huile. Le  transport de ses marchandises est un défi majeur  pour elle. La cliente souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: The customer, Mwamini, is advisor to the Asifiwe group. She is a young entrepreneur who is 29 years old, married and mother to four children. Her husband is a civil servant. The customer sells palm oil at the Nyabushongo market and she began her business with a loan from Hekima. She has had 20 loans as part of the microfinance project. Thanks to this program she says she has been able to realise several small projects. This new loan will allow her to buy seven barrels of oil. Transporting her goods is a major challenge for her. The customer would like to buy a plot of land and be able to educate her children. She is thus grateful to Hekima.

loans.use: to buy seven barrels of oil.

loans.name: Mungu Iko Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahindo est président du groupe Mungu Iko, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est agent dans une société de tabac (supermatch). Cette cliente fait la coupe-couture dans son atelier. Elle commença avec son fonds propre et son mari lui paya une machine à coudre. Bientôt 18 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Elle rêve ouvrier un grand atelier et devenir modéliste de la ville. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les tissus, dentelles, boutons, fils, etc. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.
texts.en: Kahindo is the leader of the Mungu Iko group. She is 40 years old, a dynamic entrepreneur and the mother of 6 children, who all attend school. Her spouse is an employee of a tabacco company (Supermatch). Kahindo provides sewing and tailoring services in her workshop. She started her business with her own funds and her husband bought her a sewing machine. She has been in this line of work for nearly 18 years. She dreams of opening a large workshop and becoming the town's main designer. This new loan will allow her to buy items like fabric, lace, buttons and thread. She thanks Hekima for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and married with nine children, of whom six children are in school. Ana works very hard to provide for them.
Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, cream, etc.
Ana has been in this business for 15 years.
In the future Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, cream, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale sweets.

loans.name: David Martin

texts.es:
David, se ha decidido por continuar trabajando con préstamos, para invertir en el nuevo cultivo que realiza como la compra de fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono, esto le ayudara para que realizando su trabajo tenga lo más necesario  y el cultivo sea más productivo.
Él considera que las siembras han mejorado, debido a la aplicación de los materiales necesarios, esto tambien le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica, con la venta de la cosecha, en este periodo comenta que ha adquirido una moto, que ya es un avance para trasladarse a distintos lugares.
texts.en:
David has decided to to take out loans for his work, in order to invest in the new crop he is cultivating by buying fertilizers, pesticides and compost. This will help him because he will have everything he needs to work and his crop will be more productive.

He believes that his crops have improved thanks to the use of the necessary materials. This, in turn, has helped him to improve his economic situation through the sale of his harvest. He says that he has recently purchased a motorbike, a step forward which allows him to travel to different places.

loans.use: to but fertilizers, pesticides and compost.

loans.name: Lilian Esperanza

texts.es:
Lilian es una joven mujer emprendedora, luchadora con mucha energía de 26 años de edad casada y de ella dependen 3 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela y cursan diferentes grados. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo que gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudo cursar. Ella trabaja la agricultura hace mas de 15 años actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres mismos que se han dedicado desde toda una vida a esta labor. Ella y su esposo lucharon y trabajaron por mucho tiempo para poder comprar un terreno el cual hoy en día trabajan de forma propia sembrando en el café el cual es venido en la zona donde ellos viven.

Actualmente Lilian solicita ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, para su cultivo de café ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar su cosecha y evitara que se contamine por la roya enfermedad que daña y destruye los cultivos de café en su totalidad de ser afectados.  

Su meta es poder cancelar su préstamo para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y seguir mejorando su cultivo. Sus sueños como toda madre de familia es darles a sus hijos una mejor educación, para que de esa forma tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo, sean personas emprendedoras y que algún día ellos puedan tener su propio negocio y mejoren su estilo y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lilian, 26, is a young, enterprising, tenacious and energetic woman. She is married and has three children that go to school and are in different years. She finished primary school thanks to her parents’ efforts.

Lilian has worked in agriculture for more than fifteen years, an activity that her parents, who have been doing it all their lives, taught her. Lilian and her husband worked hard for a long time in order to buy a piece of land where they now work independently, growing coffee and selling it locally.

Lilian is requesting help to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee plantation, in order to be able to improve her crops and protect them from the “roya” fungus [leaf rust], a disease that harms and destroys the plants that become ill.

Lilian’s goal is to be able to pay the loan and continue working and improving her plantation. Her dreams, as any other mother’s, is to give her children a better education so that they can have better job opportunities, become entrepreneurial persons and in the future can have their own business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nokeira Marilu

texts.es:
Nokeira es una joven de 29 años de edad soltera dedicada a los oficios domésticos y a la caficultura. Su padre quien desde toda una vida se ha dedicado al cultivo y siembra de café le heredo una propiedad para que ella pudiera trabajar y generar sus ingresos para poder sostenerse y cubrir sus necesidades. Ella vive con su madre la cual le ha enseñado a ser una persona honrada y muy trabajadora ya que para ella es un ejemplo de su familia y en toda la comunidad. Nokeira tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de recursos monetarios.

Hoy en día Nokeira solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación lo cual le ayudara a mantener su cultivo sano y libre de cualquier plaga o enfermedad que pueda destruir su cultivo como la roya.

Su meta es lograr sacar una buena cosecha la cual le permita generar ingresos para poder cumplir con su sueño que es de crear una micro-empresa la cual tiene como finalidad la compra venta de café para venderlo de forma molida para consumo mismo que saldrá de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nokeira is a 29 year old woman. She is single and takes care of her home and grows coffee. Her father, who grew coffee his whole life, left her some property so she could work and generate income to support herself and cover her expenses. She lives with her mother, who taught her to be an honest and hardworking person, since she is an example for her whole family and the community. Nokeira finished primary school and was unable to keep going to school due to a lack of resources.

Now Nokeira is asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure, and fumigation pumps, which will help her to keep her crop healthy and free of any pests or diseases that can destroy it, such as blight.  

Her goal is to have a good harvest that will allow her to generate income and make her dream come true of having a micro-business which will be to buy coffee and sell it ground up for consumption, to add to her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and fumigation pumps for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja y su pequeña bebé de 6 meses, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Joaquín pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar diversos trabajos técnicos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Joaquín trabaja en su pequeño negocio de reparación de equipos celulares, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el buen servicio que brinda.
Joaquín se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una máquina para software, la cual le servirá de mucho para programas y desbloquear equipos celulares, así pues Joaquín seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y así sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a 29 year old man. He lives in the city of Chincha with his spouse and 6 month old baby daughter, whom he loves and who is his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who puts all of his efforts into getting his family ahead. Thanks to the hard work and support of his parents, Joaquín was able to study Business Administration. In his free time, he likes to do different technical jobs and sometimes he cooks a delicious Carapulcra with Sopa Seca to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Joaquín works at his small business repairing cell phones. He works every day for about 10 hours and he believes it is going well for him because of the good service he offers. 

Joaquín is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to buy a software machine. This will really help him for programs and to unblock cell phones. This way, Joaquín will continue to work and strive to make his big dream come true of expanding his business and getting his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a machine for software.

loans.name: Keburana Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe  keburana  et  habite à Gitega. C’est une mère-célibataire de  25 ans. Elle a 2 enfants, âgés de 5  à  8ans, dont  1étudie.
Elle prend soin d’un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, …) depuis 7 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, …)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle  parvient  à satisfaire les besoins de la famille (se nourrir, se loger, se vêtir)
texts.en: Annociate is a member of the Keburana group and lives in Gitega. She is a 25-year-old single mother of 2 children, aged 5 and 8, one of whom goes to school. She is taking care of a child who is a member of her extended family and also a student. She has been selling groceries (beans, rice, etc.) in her shop for 7 years. This is her 7th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy many food items (beans, rice, etc.) for her to resell in her shop, so that she can earn more money. She manages to take care of her family's needs (food, lodging and clothing) with the earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy food items (beans, rice, etc.) for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Drissa   Kouyate

texts.fr:
Monsieur DRISSA est né vers 1968 à Loulouni cercle de  KADIOLO.  Il est père de 7enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle LOULOUNI - VILLE (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Drissa est un jardinier qui  possède un hangar au marché de LOULOUNI VILLE afin de bien mener son activité de vente de légumes frais depuis près de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit beaucoup de commandes.
Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il a sollicité la collaboration de l’Institution de microfinance Soro. Il est à son 2ème prêt.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter de semences, de petits matériels agricoles, d’engrais et de carburant pour sa moto pompe. 
Ils s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de SIKASSO au besoin.  Après production il vend ses produits au comptant, sur commande et en détail sous son hangar à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte aménager son jardin afin de ravitailler convenablement en légume frais  sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’agrandir.
texts.en:
Drissa was born around 1968 in Loulouni, Kadiolo Circle. He is the father of 7 children and lives in a traditional family in the town of Loulouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Drissa is a vegetable gardener and owns a shed at the market of Loulouni town, where he has been running his business selling fresh vegetables for almost 6 years. His experience in his line of work has earned him a good reputation and many orders.

He is seeking assistance from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to have the necessary resources with which to satisfy his customers. This is his 2nd loan. This loan will enable him to buy seeds, small agricultural tools, fertilizer and oil for a power pump. He gets his supplies from the Sikasso Grand Market when he needs them. When he has grown the vegetables he sells his produce for cash, to order and to retail customers in his shed in Loulouni, to a clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 70 000 francs. Part of this profit will allow him to pay off the loan interest and to cover most of his expenses, and part will be reinvested in his business. He plans to develop his garden so that he can offer enough fresh vegetables to his ever-growing clientèle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, small agricultural tools, fertilizer and oil for a power pump.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leah works hard to support her family. She has a fish pond business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Leah is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay a laborer's salary and to purchase feed for her fish pond business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay a laborer's salary and to purchase feed for her fish.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has 3 children who are in school. Lorena has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 13 years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Milagros Rosarito

texts.en:
Milagros Rosarito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. Milagros Rosarito has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe BENKADI sont  essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM 1ère assise à droite sur la photo, fait le commerce de  céréales  dans ce  groupe de femmes BENKADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3 sacs de maïs des céréales.Elle s’approvisionne dans les environs du village de Siékourani. 
Elle les revend essentiellement au  marché de Siékourani et au marché de Loulouni ville le jour de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The 5 members of the Benkadi group are mostly married women with an average age of 27 and, on average, 2 children. They mainly live in polygamous families in Siékourani, one of the villages Loulouni commune, Kadiolo circle, in the Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This is their 3rd loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Mariam, sitting on the far right in the picture, is the Benkadi group member who sells cereals. She is planning to use her loan to buy 3 bags of corn and cereals. She gets her supplies in the vicinity of Siékourani village. She makes most of her sales at the Siékourani and Loulouni town markets on market days for cash to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest, and part of which will be used to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy corn and cereals.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 59 years old and married with ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc.

She has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Sarah works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Sarah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional food like peanuts, fertilized duck eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food like peanuts, fertilized duck eggs, etc.

loans.name: Munkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhsaikhan, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife has the position of teacher at a kindergarten and began her work in 2012. Before becoming a full time teacher, she had been working as an assistant teacher since 2007. 

Munkhsaikhan himself has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2003, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service field. In 2003, he began to work as a taxi driver for a business entity that rendered taxi service. But the next year, he found that rendering taxi service himself was more profitable than working for a company. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for repairing his automobile. As a result, he can continue to render his taxi service to local people and generate income for his family. He is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Gnogondeme Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe GNOGONDEME sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle les prêts passés ont bien dénoués.
DJELIKA 1ère debout à droite sur la photo fait la restauration dans ce groupe de femmes GNOGONDEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des condiments, du riz et du fagot.  Elle s’approvisionne à Siékourani et dans les villages environnants. Elle prépare et vend ses plats alimentaires au  marché du village (Siékourani) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The eight members of GNOGONDEME Group are mostly married women who average 40 years of age and four children.

Most of them live in polygamous families in Siékourani, a village in the commune of Loulouni, Kadiolo Cercle (Sikasso), third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Previous loans ended without problems.

Djelika, first one standing on the right in the photograph, runs a food serving business. She will use her part of the loan to buy condiments, rice, and firewood.

She gets her supplies in Siékourani and in the surrounding villages. She prepares her dishes and sells them for cash at the market in Siékourani, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40). She will use part of it to repay the loan and interests, and the rest will be put away.

loans.use: to buy condiments, rice and firewood

loans.name: Godly

texts.en: Godly is married. Her husband is a basic grains merchant. She continues to take care of her hog raising business from the comfort of her home in order to support her children. She is asking for a loan in order to invest in her business. This will increase her income and allow her to offer her clients better service. This will benefit her family's economy.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells fish in the local community to earn a living. She has had her business for more than 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
This loan will help Danny expand his inventory to provide faster printer repair services to his clients.

Danny has been the owner of his home-based company, Printer Solutions, for the past 19 years. In addition to repairing printers, Danny also offers technical assistance, including training, networking, and upgrade service, to small business owners and home PC users. Danny serves local customers throughout the Santa Clarita Valley in California and also accepts clients online. 

Danny needs a loan to help him expand his inventory and reduce his shipping costs in order to better serve his clients.

Visit Danny’s website at http://www.printersolutions.info.

loans.use: to expand his inventory and lower shipping costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and to obtain state licensing.

loans.name: Marychel

texts.en:
Marcychel is 29 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling used clothing in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more then 2 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional used clothing products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of banana production in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 44 years old and married with a 3-year-old. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting banana production in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 7 years and earns 4,500 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 2 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and soap. She wants and hopes to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and soap

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 29 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Merlyn is engaged in a used-clothing business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing a bundle of used clothing for her used-clothing business.
 
Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing for her used-clothing business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 65 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She runs and operates a coconut production business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for almost nine years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and married with one child. She lives in Tambulig, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns a business selling firewood in the local community. She has been with her business for over nine years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She has requested a loan of 5,800 PHP to use as additional capital to purchase firewood. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with one child. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than five years, and earns 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 50 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a concrete products business in the local community to earn a living and earns 20,000 PHP every month. He has been with his business for over 10 years.

He joined GDMPC last year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional concrete materials

loans.name: Ganhurel

texts.en:
Mr. Ganhurel is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife, Narantsetseg, age 38, works as saleswoman in a local grocery store. His son Baasannyam is currently unemployed, while his daughter, Baasanjargal, age 14, and son Buyanbadrah, age 10, study at local schools. 

He has been running his inter-city transportation service business for 15 years. He is an experienced, hardworking and energetic man. He is now requesting 800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a small car to let his son to start a taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase a small car to let his son to start a taxi service business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She has a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has had her business for more than 5 years, and earns 23,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Elisa's Group

texts.en:
Elisa is 65 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 2 children.

Elisa has a business buying and reselling nuts, and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan to purchase additional nuts for her business.

Elisa joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Elisa hopes to expand her business. Elisa is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional nuts for her retail business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 56 years old and widowed with 1 child. She lives in Tambulig, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 9 years and earns 2,200 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008 and now she has requested a loan of 4,600 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 32 years old, married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Christy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Christy requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Christy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Christy would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Honey Center Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and lives in Tuburan Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children.

Jocelyn has a shop that sells Avon products. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock  for her cosmetics business like Avon products.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock  for her cosmetics business like Avon products.

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, está casada con Jorge ,con quien tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores, tiene una casa propia la cual comparte con toda su familia, juntos ponen el mayor esfuerzo para conseguir un mejor nivel de vida.El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, lencería y zapatos , realiza esta función vendiendo a crédito entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares a quienes cobra de manera semanal o mensual ,por lo general todos los productos que vende son por pedidos específicos de sus clientes. Lleva en este trabajo más de 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su pareja y sus dos hijas. Cuando se inició en éste negocio estaba llena de dudas e inseguridades, sin embargo poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora se volvió una excelente comerciante.Le gusta su trabajo porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos y tiene el tiempo necesario para cumplir con sus funciones de ama de casa, tiene muchos planes a futuro entre ellos desea establecer un local donde pueda exhibir adecuadamente todos sus productos y atender de manera mas cómoda a todos sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará prendas de vestir,lencería y sandalias femeninas de diversos diseños y de gran calidad.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50, is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She is married to Jorge, and they have three adult children. The family shares a house that they own and together, they fight to have a better quality of life.

Sonia sells clothes, lingerie and shoes. She sells on credit, among friends, neighbors and relatives, and collects the money weekly or monthly. Normally, her customers order what they want to buy in advance. Sonia has had this business for more than twenty-two years. She does well and her partner and two daughters help her. When she started this business, she was unsure and doubtful, but with time she learned and has become an excellent saleswoman.

Sonia likes her job because she produces her own income and has enough time left to take care of the household chores. She has numerous plans for the future. For instance, she would like to open a store where she can display her products better and offer a more comfortable environment to her customers.

Sonia is requesting a loan for 1500 soles [PEN]. She feels grateful with all those who will make this loan possible, helping her to continue pursuing her goals. She promises to pay the installments on time. With the loan, she will buy a wide assortment of garments, lingerie and sandals for women, all of great quality.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lingerie and sandals for women.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 54 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. Azucena works very hard to provide for them.

Azucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like rice, snack foods, etc.

Azucena has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft-drinks, bread and other groceries.

In the future Azucena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like rice and snack foods

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and has 6 children. Leonora is 62 years old and lives in Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occ.

Leonora sells hotcakes and puto (rice cakes) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase raw ingredients.

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Leonora hopes to expand her snacks vending.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food production

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Compi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER DE COMPI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nuevo integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leonarda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, cosecha y venta de cebolla, pesca, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leonarda es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace doce años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía se identifica a el esposo de la señora Miriam que acompaña al grupo, él esta vestido con una chompa blanca y azul
texts.en:
The community bank Nuevo Amanecer de Compi is starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group has nine members and it is led by a board, of which Leonarda is the president.  The businesses that the members have are varied and include: vegetable sales, harvesting and selling onions, fishing, a neighborhood store, and fish sales.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like themselves.  Leonarda is a member of the group.  She joined Pro Mujer six months ago by invitation of a consultant from the institution that visited her home.  Currently she has a business selling vegetables.  She learned the business herself about 12 years ago.

This loan will be used to purchase vegetables.  She acquires them from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sells them at her market stall.  This type of works allows her to earn income to support her household since she lives in a common law marriage and has two children.    

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings on health and the loans.  

In the photograph, Miriam's husband is standing with the group.  He is dressed in a blue and white sweater.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es: Libia de 47 años de edad es madre 3 hijos en las edades de  14 a 16 años.  En sus 13 años de experiencia ha logrado sostener su hogar y fortalecer sus negocios, mediante los cuales   produce sandalias femeninas, elabora productos derivados de la harina de trigo y postres, además de  ofrecer mercancías variadas, de contado y a crédito. Ella permanece  trabajando de lunes a domingos, desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y referidos por estos, que están ubicaos en el área de acción de su domicilio. En la actualidad el aumento de las solicitudes de su clientela  variada, es superior a su capacidad de compra, pues no tiene un capital d trabajo suficiente, para lograr responderle  oportunamente   y ganar descuentos por compras en mayor volumen; esta es la razón para acudir a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para aumentar su producción de sandalias para damas y para comprar materias primas e insumos con los cuales elaborará postres con lo cual tendrá  disponibilidad de productos para servir efectivamente a su clientela.
texts.en:
47-year old Libia has three children between the ages of 14 and 16. She has thirteen years of experience making women’s sandals, and she also makes wheat flour-based desserts and other products which she sells for cash or on credit. With the income she has managed to support her family and grow the businesses. Libia works every day of the week from 10 in the morning to 8 at night. Her customers are mostly neighbours or people living nearby who have been referred to her.

Right now orders from customers are greater than her ability to buy ingredients because she doesn’t have sufficient working capital. Nor can she buy in large quantities so she can get a discount. For this reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva, via the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, her first with this organization. With the money she will buy materials and increase production of women’s sandals. She also plans to buy ingredients and supplies to make desserts and in this way be able to respond to her customers’ requests in a more timely manner.

loans.use: buy materials for making women's sandals, and ingredients for making desserts

loans.name: Sabali Kagni Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SABALI KAGNI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
ADAM 1ère assise à droite sur la photo fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique dans ce groupe de femmes SABALI KAGNI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 cartouches de cigarettes + 50kg de sucre + 1 carton de lait concentré + 2 cartons de thé  et 1bidon de 10litres d’huile végétale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle les revend dans sa boutique à Siékourani village en face du goudron (R.N) qui va jusqu’à ZEGOUA à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabali Kagni group are married women who average 33 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in polygamous families in Siekourani, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Kadiolo area (Sikasso), Mali's third administrative region. 

They are on their fourth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy their customer demand; their previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Within the Sabali Kagni group, Adam, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, sells various shop products. With her loan she is planning to buy ten cartons of cigarettes, 50kg of sugar, one carton of concentrated milk, two cartons of tea and one 10-liter container of vegetable oil. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's Grand Market. 

She resells the products in her shop in Siékourani village, opposite the main road which goes to Zegoua, for cash to a customer base made up of men and women.
