She expects to make an average monthly profit of 37,500FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, and the rest put into her savins

loans.use: to buy various shop products.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont  essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle les précédents ont été bien dénoués.
ROKIA 1ère  assise à gauche, fait le commerce de céréales  dans  ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 sacs de riz de production locale. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Siekourani..
Elle les revend au  marché du dit village le jour de foire et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.750 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The nine members of JIGUISSEME Group are mostly married women averaging 32 years of age and three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Siekourani, one of the villages in the Loulouni commune in Kadiolo Cercle (Sikasso), third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their fourth loans from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their clientele's needs. Previous loans ended without problems.

Rokia, sitting on the left in the picture, is selling cereals. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 2 sacks of locally produced rice. She gets her supplies in the villages surrounding Siekourani.

She retails for cash at the Siekourani market during fair days and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 12'750 (ca US$ 25). Part of it will be used to repay the loan and interests, while the rest be put away.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Estrella De Cristo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLA DE CRISTO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de zapatos, venta de frutas, tejido y trenzado de mantas, venta de calzados, venta de choripanes, taller de carpintería, venta de celulares, tienda de carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de choripanes (emparedados); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, ya que ella trabajó en un negocio aparte y aprendió a realizar este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de moledora para la elaboración de chorizos) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo distribuirá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta los préstamos, el servicio de salud.
texts.en:
The Estrella de Cristo communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office.  It's made up of 10 members governed by a board of directors of which Sandra is the secretary.  The various business that the members of the bank carry out are grocery store, shoe sales, weaving and knitting blankets, footwear sales, sandwich sales, carpentry shop, cell-phone sales, and butcher shop. 

Their loan will benefit small business women such as Sandra.  She says it's her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of an officer of the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently she has a business selling chorizo sandwiches.  She says she started this business years ago, because she worked in a separate business and learned to make this product.

This loan is to increase her capital buying a grinder to make chorizo.  She'll get it from the stores in the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales stall.  This job allows her to generate resources to support herself, because she's single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans and the health services.

loans.use: to buy a grinder

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan  tiene 27 años,  el  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la comunidad de Cullucachi,  este préstamo es su segunda primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Juan  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su trabajo, El Sr. Juan  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, El Sr. Juan  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
27-year old Sr. Juan works as a contract bricklayer building and renovating houses. He lives in the community of Cullucachi. This is his second loan within the first loan cycle with the institution Emprender. He plans to use the money to buy construction material so that he can do his work more efficiently. He already has several contracts to complete. 

Juan expects to continue improving his business by buying work tools as those he has are worn out and he needs to buy new ones. He is a very hardworking person, and he is happy to have this opportunity to get a loan. His work is his only way of supporting himself.

loans.use: buy building supplies

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, de 22 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos , vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hermana y en conjunto buscan día a día mejorar su calidad de vida.El trabajo de Carla consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas en las diferentes tallas, colores y modelos para damas caballeros y niños, ella se encarga personalmente de comprar las prendas al por mayor y de seleccionarlas una a una pensando siempre en lo que más le gusta a su público . Trabaja con ayuda de su mamá y lleva en éste trabajo un promedio de 3 años, este trabajo lo realiza desde su casa o visitando algunas viviendas, ha logrado tener una lista de clientes fijos entre amigos y familiares y algunas veces vende a crédito y otras veces al contado y por ello recibe buenas ganancias que le ayudan a mantener su solvencia económica.Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene la libertad de manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, al principio como toda persona que recién empieza con un negocio propio tuvo algunas inseguridades pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos y ahora es una gran generadora de ingresos en la economía de su hogar, espera poner una tienda de ropas para seguir contribuyendo en el progreso de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para comprar una gran cantidad de prendas de vestir tales como polos , blusas y pantalones y asi continuar brindando prendas de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carla is 22 years old, single, and does not have children.  She is a kind and hardworking woman.  She lives in her parent's house together with her sister.  Together they try every day to improve their quality of life.  

Carla works selling clothing from different brands in different sizes, colors, and models for women, men, and children.  She personally purchases all the clothing at wholesale and selecting them one by one, while always thinking about what her customers would like most.  She works with the help of her mother and has been doing this work for three years.  She works from her home or visits some customers at home.  She has succeeded in having a fixed list of customers among her friends and family.  She sometimes sells on credit and other times in cash and receives a good income that help her maintain her financial solvency.  She likes what she does very much because she has the freedom to manage her time and organize herself according to the availability of her customers.  At the beginning, she had some insecurities, as does everyone who recently opened a business, but with time, she overcame them and now is a great income generator for her household.  She hopes that she can open a clothing store to continue contributing to her family's progress.  

She is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to purchase a large quantity of clothing items such as polo shirts, blouses, and pants in order to continue offering quality clothing items to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase items of clothing.

loans.name: Lamane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été créé le 15 Juin 2009 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 27 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier, solidarité et entre aide caractérise ce groupe. Elles ont des restaurants et font du petit commerce.
Madame Lamane  (assise l’extrême droit avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est veuve et prend en charge en partie ses deux garçons étudiants dans la capitale. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée à base de pin de singe et de bissap. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter trois sacs de pin de singe de 50 kilos à 7 500 FCFA le sac, deux sacs de feuilles de bissap à 6 500 FCFA, deux sacs de sucre à 25 000 CFA l’unité et les divers produits entrant dans le processus de préparation des jus et crèmes glacées.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter son soutien à ses deux garçons au besoin dans leurs études universitaire d’une part et d’autre part épargné d’avantage pour bénéficier d’un crédit plus considérable dans le futur.
texts.en:
This group was created June 15, 2009 at the inauguration of the local "banc villageois" loan group. It consists of 27 women who all live in the same neighborhood. The group is characterized by solidarity and mutual aid. Members operate restaurants and run small businesses.

Mrs. Lamane (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is a widow and provides partial support to her two sons who are students in the capital. She sells ice cream made ​​from monkey bread (fruit of the baobab tree) and hibiscus.

With her ​​loan she plans to buy three 50-kilo bags of monkey bread (fruit of the baobab) at 7500 FCFA per bag, two bags of hibiscus leaves at 6500 FCFA per bag, two bags of sugar at 25,000 FCFA each and various products used in the preparation of juices and ice creams.

Benefits will serve on the one hand to support her two boys' needs during their university-level studies, and on the other hand to increase her savings so that she can qualify for a larger loan in the future.

loans.use: buy three 50-kilo bags of monkey bread (fruit of the baobab) at 7500 FCFA per bag, two bags of hibiscus leaves at 6500 FCFA per bag, two bags of sugar at 25,000 FCFA each and various products used in the preparation of juices and ice creams.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 48 years old and works hard to support her children. She does not want to leave them alone at home during the day, so she raises pigs for a living. She manages to generate enough income to feed and educate her children. Her dream is to own a farm because she is convinced that the country is the best place to live, and this would give her the ability to earn more money by raising crops as well as pigs. She has ambitious dreams, and knows that she has to save in order to achieve her wishes. She is asking for this loan to buy pigs to raise. She expects that she will be able to improve her quality of life through hard work and discipline, and that she will be able to guarantee an education to her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 57 years old. She lives in Tbilisi with her 66-year-old husband, son and retired mother in-law. Naira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Naira works in a restaurant as an assistant to the cook. Her husband is a driver for the local mini-bus and her son bakes bread at the local bakery. They all get very small monthly payments, which is not enough to support themselvs. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Naira requested a loan from Credo to start a family business, which was stopped recently because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This startup loan program provides business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Naira will renovate an unused commercial space and make it into a living space. She will rent the room and will get a fixed monthly income. The new business initiative, financed with this Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate an unused commercial space as living space to rent it out.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 44 years old and lives in Lumad, Pagadian City. She is married and the mother of one child. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells dry goods. She is requesting this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Florencia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to buy dry goods for her wholesale business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hija s en las edades de  2 y 13 años , al suroccidente de la ciudad donde tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de alquiler de máquinas para lavar y que además ha agregado la venta de mercancías variada, aprovechando entre sus clientes del primer servicio tiene un mercado que ha construido durante un periodo de 4 años, cuando dio inicio a su negocio. Ella buscando generar ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar, principalmente los inherentes a sus hijas, puso en marcha esta iniciativa y ha logrado sostenerse en el tiempo. Su capacidad de trabajo, pues trabaja todos los días de la semana durante 13 horas le ha permitido impulsar su negocio, generar nuevas formas de mercadear y aprovechar oportunidades de responder a su clientela que continúa creciendo. Su capital de trabajo para comprar maquinarias que satisfagan el requerimiento de su mercado, no es suficiente y esta es la razón para acudir a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 3 lavadoras y algunas mercancías que requiere para cumplir con pedidos. Su credikiva proyecta ser exitoso porque lo realiza en el marco de su experiencia de mercado y para responder oportunamente a su clientela que muchas veces se va de su negocio sin obtener respuesta al servicio. Su mayor desafío consiste en lograr ahorrar lo suficiente para algún día tener su propia casa y genera aun mucho mas bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariela lives with her husband and two daughters who are 2 and 13 years old. She lives in the south west part of the city, where she has a shop which offers washing machine rental services. She has also acquired various goods to sell to clients who initially come in to the shop for rental services. 

She has been providing services and selling goods for 4 years, since her shop first opened. Looking to generate income to support her household, mainly for her children's expenses, she set up her business and managed to keep it going over the years. Her strong work ethic - she works 13 hours a day, everyday of the week - has enabled her to move forward with her business and create new ways of buying and selling, taking every opportunity to respond to the demands of a client base that is continually growing. 

She doesn't have enough money to buy all the machinery she needs to satisfy client demand, which is why she is requesting a Kiva loan. It is her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy 3 washing machines and other goods that she requires to fulfill her orders. 

She expects the Kiva loan to be successful because it will be used in the context of her business where she has ample experience and because she will be able to satisfy her clients who many times have had to leave empty-handed because she cannot keep up with demand. 

Her biggest challenge is to save up enough money to be able to buy her own house one day and to be able to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines and various goods

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 from Kiva and the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She has successfully paid back a previous loan and is requesting a new one to continue expanding her business. Her goal for the future is to provide her family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Cherry Lynn

texts.en:
Cherry Lynn is 31 years old and lives in Lumbia District, Pagadian city. She is married with two children.
   
Cherry Lynn has a general store that sells dry goods. She has had this business for one year.  She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap.
  
Cherry Lynn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future she hopes to have a bigger store and earn capital for her business for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 34 years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children.

Ma. Theresa has a general store that sells different canned goods and foods for daily needs. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan  to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, canned goods and foods for daily needs.

Ma. Theresa has been a member of PMPC for five years.  Ma. Theresa hopes to make her little store into a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, canned goods and foods for daily needs.

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 40 years old, married with one child. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business with vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for almost four years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 27 years of age, is married to a farmer and they blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store for almost six years. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 4,000 every month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase condiments, canned goods, noodles, and beverages to sell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, canned goods, noodles, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 47 years old and lives in the village of Casibarag, which is in the province of Isabela. For the last 16 years, she has earned a living by raising hogs. She is the hardworking and patient mother of three children, and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy feed and additional piglets. Her goal is to increase her income so that she can pay her family's expenses. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to expand her business so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 55 years old, married and the mother of eleven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Teresita has been farming sugarcane for 13 years and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is working tirelessly toward her goal of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie, de 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy joven, es soltera y no tiene hijos,  vive en casa de sus padres junto a su sobrino y su hermana, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y asegurar su economía.El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa como polos, pantalones, blusas y camisas. Vende sus productos entres los amigos de su barrio, familiares y compañeros de trabajo además ofrece artículos de buena marca ,con diseños innovadores pero sobre todo de muy buena calidad. Lleva en este trabajo cerca de 3 años y lo realiza con el apoyo de su madre y su hermana.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia ya que le permite tener tiempo y espacio suficiente para desarrollar otra actividad laboral en un conocido local de venta de combustibles de la ciudad y lo hace sin descuidar a su familia, asegura que su negocio es rentable por que obtiene buenas ganancias, tiene muchos planes y sueños por cumplir, pero por ahora desea con muchas ganas abrir su propia tienda para asi exhibir sus prendas con mayor comodidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir , de igual forma se siente contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo económico que le permite avanzar con su negocio y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Steffanie, age 22, is an enterprising woman.  She is very young, single, and has no children.  She lives with her nephew and her sister in her parents’ house.  She works a lot because she wishes to give her parents a better quality of life and secure her financial situation.

Steffanie’s work consists of selling clothes like polo type shirts, pants, blouses, and shirts.  She sells her products among her friends in the neighborhood, family members, and work colleagues.  She also sells good brands with innovative designs.  Above all, she sells very good quality items.  She has been doing this work for close to three years.  She does this with the help of her mother and her sister.

What she likes about her work is her independence.  It allows her to have enough time and space to develop another work activity in a well-known spot for selling fuel in the city.  She is sure that her business is profitable because she gets good income.

She has many plans and dreams to fulfill.  However, for now she really wishes to open her own store in order to display her garments more comfortably.

She will now request a loan for 1,500 soles in order to buy a greater quantity of clothes.  She is happy to know that she can count on financial support.  This will allow her to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina lives with her life partner and son. She owns a store in which she sells necessity products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and soap, among other things. She has had the business for many years now, which has given her sales experience and has allowed her to always make the best profits. She is well known in her area, and people recommend her store because it is always well stocked. She always has what people need at good prices and offers good-quality products and excellent customer service. 

Avelina is a dedicated and hard-working woman. She is energetic and motivated to get ahead in life; she enjoys fighting for her dreams. She knows that if she works hard, she can achieve whatever she sets out to do and she will be successful in life.

As with any good salesperson, she would like to grow her business and invest more. For this reason, she is requesting a loan amounting to 7000 PHP, which will allow her to buy basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks, soap, etc. She has good payment references and impeccable morals. She is confident she can pay off her debt and is sure she will be able to bring economic stability to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks, and soap for her store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for the business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es:
Mirna de la Cruz, madre soltera con dos hijos de 23,13 años,  de 46 años de edad, originaria de León. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Mirna se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su espíritu de emprendedor es que tiene por actividad económica la producción de tortillas, desde hace 9 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación; la rutina diaria de Mirna es levantarse a las  4:00 am a preparar el maíz par nixquezar y luego moler y elaborar las tortillas. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas como: maíz, leña, cal, gas, fosforo, bolsas plásticas, comales. Mirna de la cruz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mirna de la Cruz is a single mother with two children who are 13 and 23 years old. She is 46 years old and comes from León, in the West of the country. Mirna considers herself as a hard-worker who is responsible and really wants to better herself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she couldn't go to university and went straight to work at an early age, Now she fights everyday to give her children a better future. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit she set up a business producing tortillas which she has been running from home for 9 years. Everyday Mirna gets up at 4am to prepares the maize to cook and grind and then make tortillas. She enjoys her job a lot. 

The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, buying staple goods for tortilla production such as maize, wood, lime, gas, matches, plastic bags and griddle pans. 

Mirna de la cruz is grateful for the help that kiva borrowers offer to people with scarce resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a way of working with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital, buying staple goods such as maize, wood, gas, griddles, plastic bags and lime.

loans.name: Carlos Leonardo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Carlos no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Computación e Informática, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace un año Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en diversos fundos y parcelas, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de 2 mochilas fumigadoras, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder brindar servicios de curado y fumigación de cultivos, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y asi poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district with his parents and brothers.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because he needed to work to help his parents, Carlos was not able to study Computing and Informatics at university, but he would have liked to do so.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks rice with duck to share with his family.  

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Carlos has been working for a year as a field worker at various farms and plots.  He works every day for about eight hours and believes it is going well because of his responsibility and the kind treatment he gives everyone.  

Carlos is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase two fumigation backpacks, which will allow him to offer a service treating and fumigating crops.  Carlos will continue working and making an effort to achieve his goal of becoming a professional so that he can gradually succeed.

loans.use: to purchase two fumigation backpacks.

loans.name: Genova's Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODER DE DIOS”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Genova es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pollos a la brosther, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de ropa, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Genova es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Poder de Dios” is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, working with the Senkata regional office.  The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors with Genova as the president.  The members engage in different business activities including broasted chicken sales, dressmaking, clothing sales, shawl weaving, sweater knitting and meat sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro businesses like Genova’s. She says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for three loan cycles. She was invited to join by her daughter, who is a member of the organization. She currently runs a business selling fruit, a business she started all on her own. 

She will use the loan to increase her capital by purchasing fruit from wholesale vendors in La Paz and then selling it at her fruit stand. This work allows her to generate enough income to maintain her household as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and credit training classes.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Bita

texts.en: Bita is 54 years old. She has a stand where she sells fruit and vegetables, as well as eggs, drinks, plastic toys, candy. Bita always tries to have her business stocked even it is only with a few items. She lives with her life partner. Together they support their five children. Bita's business is located in front of their house, which is very positive for her, and it is in view of everyone who passes through the area. Bita is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to invest in purchasing more products in order to increase her earnings. This will allow her to serve more customers, which she hopes will allow her to continue providing all the necessities for her children.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, bananas, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Sherly works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and tricycle transport. Sherly is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to customers.

Sherly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Herlen

texts.en:
Herlen is 45 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with two children. 

Herlen offers a motorcycle for hire  and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional liters of gasoline for their own motorcycle refueling. 

Herlen has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Herlen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional liters of gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a responsible housewife who supported her husband in gaining income. She is 44 years old and has three school-age children. Due to financial insufficiency, Nancy operates their motorcycle transport to generate income while her husband cultivates their farmland. She planned to continuously operate the motorcycle, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to generate sufficient income from the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hog-raiser who lives in Solana with her spouse and children. She raises and sells hogs for income. She has been in her small business for almost five years and earns about 3,000 PHP for each hog disposal. 

She wants to raise healthy hogs, but it requires sustenance for feed and vaccines. Because of this, she is asking for 9,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability. This will help improve the nutrition of the hogs so she can sell them at profitable cost someday. Additional revenue will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad, 55 years old, is widowed and has eight children. She lives in Casibarag. She is a persistent woman. Despite coming up against hardships, she has never despaired and has raised her children alone. She has worked selling goods for several years. She sells different vegetable in front of their house. In order to increase her turnover, she is taking out a loan to buy an assortment of vegetable and fruits. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy string beans, squash, tomatoes, eggplant, and cabbage

loans.name: Fauziya

texts.en:
Fauziya is 62 years old. She is a medic. With the help of her parents, she studied at the medical college and all her adult life she worked at the hospital as a nurse. She has six children and provided them with all necessary things by herself. Her husband is busy with farming and has a little income. Now, her children are adults and have their jobs. 

Fauziya is a pensioner and gets a small pension. She wants to organize her business with animal husbandry as her living place is good for animal husbandry and cattle are in great demand at the local market. Despite her older age, she is very hardworking and an active woman. She studied at the course called ‘To get ahead’ of a women's organization. She learnt new skills about business. Her husband will help her with hr business. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 41 years old, a mother of three, and sells dried fish to the people in her village for income. She had been in her business for over a year and earns 7,000 PHP each month. It goes for meals and school expenses. 

She hopes to keep improving her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell.

Juana hopes to become a successful vendor and keep earning funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 42 years old and married to a farmer. They are currently residing in the village of Calaoagan. She has been managing a piggery business for almost 1 year and she's earning a net income of 3,500 PHP per hog. 

She would like to avail a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to purchase some hog feed to sustain the needs of her pigs. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase some hog feed.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea, 40, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Michael and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irenea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Irenea hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store and dreams of having more customers.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Olibeth

texts.en:
Olibeth, 20 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with one child. She has been selling vegetables in their village for almost 3 years. With this business, she's earning a net income amounting to 3,000 PHP every month. 

She would like to avail a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplant, squash, string beans, and tomatoes. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted immediately to acquire more vegetables to sell in their village.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplant, squash, string beans, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 45 years old, married with three children. She describes herself as hard-working and a responsible woman. Amalia has been a vegetable vendor within her local community for three years and six months. She is thankful because through her sacrifices she is able to generate income for her family necessities. 

With her determination to increase her profit, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. She will be using this amount in buying vegetable seeds such as eggplant, squash, bitter gourd and okra seeds for her  vegetable vending business. She knows that through her hard work and additional capital she could further improve her vegetable garden which enables her to gain greater income. She hopes for approval of her requested loan amount so her goal will be realized someday.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds such as eggplant, squash, bitter gourd and okra seeds for her  vegetable growing and vending business

loans.name: Ruth Ann

texts.en:
Ruth Ann is a happy woman who enjoys managing her sari-sari store (general store) business. Ruth Ann is 56 years old, married, and has four children. With her passion to succeed, Ruth Ann patiently runs her business. Sometimes she makes ladies' accessories like rings, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings that are made from Swarovski for extra income. Through her earnings from the business, Ruth Ann builds up a stall for her sari-sari store.

Ruth Ann wishes for continued growth of the business. She manages the business well to earn higher income to financially support her youngest child in pursuing her college education. 

Ruth Ann is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, condiments, cheese curds, and sugar to sell. She thinks that this loan will have a big contribution in reaching her wish.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, condiments, cheese curds, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Bennybal

texts.en:
Bennybal runs a stall where he offers different kinds of vegetables, cooked dishes, street foods such as barbecue, milk fish and round scad (galung-gong). He is 24 years of age, married with two children. He aims to have a stable source of income so he could send his children on to higher levels  of education, give them a better way of living, and cover their daily needs.

Bennybal wants to request a loan of PHP 5,000, allowing him to buy 20 kilograms of milk fish, 20 kilograms of galunggong and different kinds of vegetables for his food stall. He hopes for approval of his requested loan in order to fulfill his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy 20 kilograms of milkfish, 20 kilograms of 'galunggong' and different kinds of vegetables for his food stall

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. He is requesting his second loan from NWTF for 25,000, which he will use to buy spare parts for his tricycle transportation business.

NWTF is re-listing Armando's business profile again in support of he efforts to secure the future of he family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Prose Gay

texts.en:
Prose Gay is 28 years old and is married to Rommel. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. To make a living, Prose Gay is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables in the village of Paddad, Alicia. 

Aside from her business, she is also engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in her businesses for almost three years. She earns about a PHP 2,500 a week. Right now, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fruits and vegetables such as string beans, squash, eggplant, carrots, mangoes and apples to sell. She hopes to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as string beans, squash, eggplant, carrots, mangoes and apples to sell

loans.name: Dibaldo Luis

texts.es:
Dibaldo es un hombre de 48 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Dibaldo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Dibaldo trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor afluencia de pasajeros.
Dibaldo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su mototaxi, de esta manera podrá tener su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dibaldo is a 48 year old, single man who lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to excel. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and because he has had to work to pay his bills, Dibaldo wasn’t able to go to school to study education, which he would have really liked to do. In his free time he likes to work and sometimes he will make a delicious dish of Ceviche for his family.

Because of his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Dibaldo works as a mototaxi driver, offering transportation services. He works about 12 hours a day, every day.  He thinks things are going well because he knows the areas that have the greatest number of passengers.

Dibaldo is very grateful for the Kiva micro loans as they have helped him to make the necessary repairs and perform general maintenance on his mototaxi.  This allows him to keep his mototaxi in good working condition so he can continue working and striving for his biggest dream, owning his own home. Little by little, he wants to get ahead.

loans.use: make  necessary repairs and perform general maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been involved in agriculture for some years. She keeps livestock, which currently includes three pigs and five chicken; she raises them for three months and she sells them using their motorcycle service. Running a business is the only source of income for her, so it is very important for her to expand it. 

Victoria is a mother of eight children and is the only breadwinner of the family. So it is very difficult for her to save money for the expansion of her business. Victoria has applied for this loan to  buy chickens, pigs and ducks for her business. Victoria is a very hardworking mother and does her best to ensure a better life for her lovely family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and ducks for her business

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa, 47 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in a  traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling). She and her husband have been making and selling accessories for shamans for ten years. 

She herself is a shaman, and ten years ago, she first made her own dress. Then the family decided to start this business. Her husband previously worked in the garment industry and accumulated the necessary skills for making dresses. 

Also she has a position as a consultant at a non-governmental organization that incorporates over 200 shamans. All shamans have their own unique animal theme, so every dress requires different types of materials. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase materials such as leather, animal fur, metals, silk, etc. As a result, she and her husband can make accessories for shamans without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who, together with her husband, wants to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather, animal fur and silks, etc.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Altansukh, 37 years old, lives with her two sons and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Five months ago, she began running a grocery store and in this short time, she has attracted quite a number of customers. A good location, her communication skills and being the sole seller of food stuffs in her area are the main reasons for her business profitability. 

As her customers increase so does the demand for goods, so she is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase food stuffs in large quantities. As a result, she can run her store without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply about the wellbeing of her sons and mother.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs in large quantities.

loans.name: Abusolomu

texts.en:
Abusolomu is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In order to support his growing family, he decided to start a retail shop and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. Like most traders, he is challenged by inadequate capital to meet the demand and by price fluctuations while his dream is to trade wholesale.

Abusolomu intends to use the loan to buy maize, cassava flour, sugar, rice and baking flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava flour, sugar,  rice, and baking flour to sell.

loans.name: Nominiana

texts.en:
Nominiana's business is a "sari-sari store" or variety store. She has been in this business for five years and usually earns about PHP 300 per day. Her income is just enough to cover their daily meals. Nominiana is 53 years old and is married, with five children.  Nominiana is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, beverages and condiments to sell. 

Nominiana hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, beverages and condiments to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is from the village of Calaocan, Alicia. She is 32 years old and is married to Noel. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with one child. To support her family, Marilyn runs her general store. She has been in this business for seven years and usually earns about a minimum of PHP 300 a day. At this moment, Marilyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy noodles, condiments, beverages, and assorted breads to resell in her 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, condiments, beverages, and assorted breads to resell in her store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 54 years old, married man, and has eight children.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and has a dairy farm from which he earns his main income. He also sells bulls and buys milk from others to meet the demand.

James is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase land to expand his farm.  He faces challenge of unpredictable weather changes, pests, and diseases. He has a dream of educating his children to the university level and expand his land for grazing.

loans.use: to purchase land to expand his farm.

loans.name: Ging-Ging

texts.en:
Ging-Ging is 30 years old and happily married to Angelo. The couple has two children and live in the village of Calaocan. For the past three years, Ging-Ging has bought and sold frozen food and she earns 550 PHP daily. 

Ging-Ging is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan to buy frozen food, such as hot-dogs, chicken, "langgonisa," and "toccino" to sell. She hopes that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen food, such as hot-dogs, chicken, "langgonisa," and "toccino" to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 65, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Along with her children, Letecia manages her household while managing her farm where she grows fruit and vegetables. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. Letecia's farm is located in Cavite which is in the highlands and well-suited to growing vegetables and other fruit. She sells her produce at the market, fruit stores, and directly to the local community.  Letecia earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every week.

Letecia is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of her loan will go toward maintenance of her farm. Letecia expects a boost in her business income as she expands. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow bigger. Letecia meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of bread.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 52 years old and is widowed with four children. She supports her children through her simple business. She has a retail store in the front of their home. She has been in this business for almost three years. Marietta is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items such as beverages, condiments, and assorted breads to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as beverages, condiments, and assorted breads to sell

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Francisca, es madre soltera de ocho hijos mayores de edad, ella se ha sacrificado trabajando día y noche para sacarlos adelante para que sean hijos de buenas costumbre, los ha guiado a todos y apoyado con su labor como vendedora ambulante de productos de aseo del hogar y a la vez se apoya con el alquiler de cuartos que ha venido construyendo en su casa, es por eso que solicita el credito para hacer otra habitación para alquilar, comprara cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, laminas de zinc, esto le vendrá a generar mas ingresos para su economía, ella espera seguir contando con mas financiamiento para seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en: Francisca’s a single mother of 8 adult children. She’s always sacrificed working day and night to move them ahead so that they would be upstanding citizens.  She’s guided all of them and supported them through her work selling home cleaning supplies from place to place; she also earns income renting rooms that she’s been building at home.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to build another room to rent.  She will buy cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, metal sheeting.  This will generate extra income for her family’s economy.  She hopes to continue to count on more financing to continue making progress in life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, metal sheeting and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 27 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 2 años, todos los días ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y mejorar la economía de su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre y hermanos.Sandra se dedica a  la costura  y confección de prendas. Desarrolla esta actividad laboral desde hace poco pues tiene mucha creatividad, sin embargo reconoce que aún está empezando en esta faceta y anhela implementar su taller de costura con todo lo que necesita para hacer un buen trabajo. Su trabajo se orienta en la confección de disfraces sean estos de dibujos animados, vestuarios típicos y vestidos para fiestas . Realiza este trabajo con ayuda de su madre de quien aprendió este oficio.Está contenta con su trabajo pues le da los ingresos económicos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, además el contacto con el público es lo que le hace sentir muy bien , ahora espera que su taller de costura continué en progreso por el bien de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, encajes, blondas, aplicaciones y todo lo necesario para implementar su taller de costura y realizar bien su trabajo , por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que le brindan  este financiamiento económico ya que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntuaal.
texts.en:
Sandra, 27, is single and has a two-year-old son.  She works very hard every day because she wants to provide better quality of life for her son and to improve her family’s economy.  She lives in her own house alongside her mother and siblings.  Sandra works sewing and manufacturing clothes.  

She’s been in this line of work for a short time and she’s very creative.  However, she’s aware that she’s barely starting out in this phase and she wants to equip her sewing workshop with everything necessary to do a good job.  Her work focuses on making costumes based on cartoon characters, traditional costumes and party outfits.  She does her work with help from her mother who taught her this occupation.  She’s happy with her work because she earns income needed to cover family expenses.  Also, contact with the public makes her feel very good.  Now, she’s hoping her workshop will continue making progress for her family’s benefit.

On this occasion, she’s asking for a 2,500 sol loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, lace, trim, appliques and everything necessary to equip her workshop and to do her work well.  Because of this, she thanks all those people who provide this financial support because it will help her increase her working capital and as a result she commits to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles among other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Carlyn

texts.en:
Maria Carlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Maria Carlyn has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from food vending.

Maria Carlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 34 and lives with her five children in a community located in Cabagan. For the past four years, she has been selling different vegetables. Jenalyn works the whole week and her customers are mainly neighbors and friends that visit her on a daily basis. She works from home and also sells beverages. 

Jenalyn is requesting a loan to buy cabbage, tomatoes, beans, and bananas to sell. In the future, she dreams of improving her house.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, beans, and bananas

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source income of Anabel. She has been in this business five years and usually earns about PHP 2,500 per hog. Anabel is married to a farmer who helps her to raise their three children. They both work hard to give them a better life. 

At this time, Anabel wants to have additional piglets to raise. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is 35 years old, married and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Elisa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Ma. Elisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora, fue profesora de secundaria, con el tiempo se propuso a poner su propio negocio, un taller de costura lo que le ayuda a cubrir sus gastos del hogar en la actualidad, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes, trabajan en el extranjero y con mucho amor le retribuyen a su madre todo lo que ha hecho por ellos apoyándola económicamente, solicita el credito para construir su cocina que esta en muy malas condiciones comprara cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, azulejos, pantri para ir poco a poco mejorando las condiciones de su hogar y ver bonita su casa.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora was a secondary school teacher and in time decided to open her own business:  a sewing workshop that helps her cover household expenses now.  Her children are all independent adults now working abroad and lovingly repay their mother for everything she did for them by supporting her economically.

She’s requesting the loan to build her kitchen which is in very poor condition.  She will buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, rebar, tile and kitchen cabinets to gradually improve her home’s condition and make her house prettier.

loans.use: to buy cement, tile and kitchen cabinets.

loans.name: Junabelle

texts.en:
Junabelle is 52 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has been running a general store and she also earns an income from a tricycle transportation business. Junabelle works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.

Junabelle is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Flor De Habas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, comerciante de queso, venta de leche, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos, aceites, abarrotes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Rosalía ya que tenía que desarrollar actividades laborales
texts.en:
Flor de Habas Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  It's made up of 10 members and governed by a board of directors of which Rita is the president.  The various businesses carried out by the communal bank members are braided rugs, cheese sales, milk sales, and neighborhood store.

Their loan will benefit small business women such as Rita.  She says it's the first time she's a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a neighborhood store, a business she learned on her own several years ago.

This loan is to increase capital by buying soft drinks, oil, and groceries, which she'll acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales stall.  This job allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, because she lives in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the savings and the health and loan trainings.

Rosalía's not in the photograph because she had work activities to do.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, groceries, and oil

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en:
Dulcesima lives with her husband, who is a builder, and their children, all of whom are studying. She works very hard making 'Halo-Halo' and typical snack foods contain  crushed ice mixed with sweet banana, milk and a local flavor 'gulaman'. Through this work she can help her husband and so they have more stability. 

Dulcesima has been doing this work for twelve years and so she is very well established in the area and has a lot of regular customers. Dulcesima is applying a loan to improve the stability of her business by buying  fruit and milk and other ingredients to make the snack foods that she sells every day. She is a very responsible and moral person. These are very positive characteristics for someone who is putting in the effort day after day to become better.

loans.use: to buy fruit and milk and other ingredients to make snack foods that she sells every day.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 44-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and also has a salon business. Sarah is a good mother and has been able to educate her child, who is now at university. Her business is impacted by price fluctuations and high license fees.

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy soda to sell. In the future, her dream is to trade in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 41 years old and widowed. She lives with her child in the community of Casibarag, in the province of Isabela. Marieta operates a business selling fruits and vegetables and she needs to work hard to provide for the needs of her child.

Marieta is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, eggplant, squash, and beans to sell to local customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant, squash, and beans for her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie, 33 years old, is married to a farmer. They are currently residing in the village of Calaoagan. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years and she's earning a net income of PHP 2,500 a month. She would like a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, and beverages

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is a 53-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Fourteen years ago she decided to venture into craft sales after assessing the demand both locally and internationally. Since then, Donata has reaped tangible benefits. Her business is strategically located on the way to Queen Elizabeth National Park and many tourists stop over to buy something from her. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital to meet customer demand.

Donata is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make crafts to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to new markets.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make crafts

loans.name: Pilita

texts.en:
Pilita is 43 years old and she lives with her husband. Both of them are very hard working people and they are very responsible in all of their endeavors. They always have the desire to be better in life and to get ahead. She works in direct selling of clothes, shorts, pants and shampoo. She always tries to get good quality clothes at affordable prices. This way she assures herself of maintaining a stable income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7000 so that she can buy a greater quantity of garments in a variety of colors, sizes, and styles. By doing so, She will have more products to sell at good prices. This way, she will improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shorts, pants, shampoo and soap for her direct selling business

loans.name: Erika Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Erika se dedica a producir tortillas suaves y tostadas, este es un producto elaborado a base de maíz, y muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre cuando ella tenía apenas dieciocho años de edad y desde entonces nace la idea de hacerlo como su medio de trabajo.
 Tiene dos hijos a su cargo y en edad escolar, y con los ingresos que obtiene vendiendo tortillas lleva el sustento diario a su hogar y para solventar los gastos de educación y de salud de sus hijos, siendo así un agente económico para su familia.
Necesita una fuente de financiamiento para adquirir maíz por quintales y leña, esto con el objetivo de disminuir los costos de producir la tortilla.
Es una persona esforzada y dedicada a sus hijos.
Su estado civil es casado.
texts.en:
Doña Erika makes toasted and regular tortillas. This is a product with a corn base and is very popular in Nicaraguan cuisine. Erika learned this work from her mother when she was barely 18 years old. That is where she got the idea of doing this to make a living.
She has two school-aged children under her care. With her income from tortilla sales, she is able to cover her household's daily needs and cover her children's health and education costs. She is therefore an economic contributor for her family.
She needs a source of financing to acquire corn by the quintal, as well as firewood. Her goal is to reduce the costs of producing tortillas.
She is a hard-working person, and dedicated to her children.
She is married.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 53 years old, married and has two children. He aims to upgrade their status of living and give his family a better life. As a way of gaining income, he operates his Isuzu Elf truck to be hired by his customers to deliver gravel and sand, seedlings, waste disposal and many other items. Due to financial insufficiency, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy gasoline, wheels and other materials needed for the maintenance of his Elf. Through this financial assistance, he believes he will be able to continuously use his Elf to generate income and hopes that someday he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and other materials needed for the maintenance of his Isuzu Elf truck

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn 33 years old and happily married with three children. For the past four years, she has been running a general store and she also has a hog-raising business to earn additional income. 

Evelyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase grocery items to sell and feed for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to improve her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Abudu

texts.en:
Abudu is 38 years old, a resident of the city outskirts and  married with four children, in addition to taking care of two widows and their children by providing them with basic needs since they lost their husbands (his brothers). 

Abudu drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job in 2004 after failing to find formal employment and yet he had to meet the growing needs of his family. Abudu mainly deals in town service transportation.

Abudu’s dream is to have his own taxi so that he will be able to earn higher income such that he can provide the best for his family and also start up small businesses for his late brothers’ wives.

His major challenge is working for people who do not pay him well which makes it hard for him to adequately meet his family needs. He also did not have enough money to purchase a taxi of his own. He therefore needs a loan to help him top up the money he has to purchase a taxi. Abudu is very hardworking and honest according to his colleagues.

loans.use: to complete the amount needed to buy a taxi

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fermented shrimp. Remia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Remia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 26 years old, married and has one child. Her husband is working abroad as a seaman. Jonalyn sells grocery items like sugar, coffee curls and breads in a stall in the market. When Jonalyn finds products customers want and that generates income, she extends her stall and the products she sells.
Jonalyn wants to expand her stall to gain higher income from the business. She wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items like powdered milk, canned goods, and spices. She hopes the loan will enable her to purchase the items at discounted prices.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like powdered milk, canned goods, and spices.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been a police officer and he was inspired into service by his love for peace. With the current riots in the country, his job has been very demanding. He also grows crops to earn extra income. He is challenged by low pay which can hardly meet his family's basic needs while his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture on a large scale. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es soltero y labora en una institución del estado desde hace tres años  desempeñándose como higienista.
  
Esta solicitando crédito a CEPRODEL para poder reparar el techo de su casa que está en mal estado  y este crédito lo utilizara en compra de cinc, perlin y pago de mano de obra.

este financiamiento lo invertirá en mejorar su vivienda y agradece a kiva a través de Ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, porque solo así a podido ir  acondicionando su vivienda dando mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Alberto lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a hard-working person who fights for his family's well-being and future. He is single and has worked as a dental hygienist for a state institution for three years.
He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for the purpose of repairing his home's roof, as it is in bad shape. He will use this loan to buy zinc and purlin beams, and to pay the labourers.
He will invest this loan in improving his home. He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for whatever support they can provide, because this is the only way he can keep improving his home and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes lives at Solana. She is married and has three children. Her spouse is a carpenter while she sells dried fish for income. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis and generates about P 5,000 monthly. She is now asking for additional capital in the amount of P13,000 to invest in the business. She will buy more dried fish to sell. She will also buy fruit to include in her sales. 

Someday, Mercedes would like to become a succesful entrepreneur and give better way of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and fruit to sell

loans.name: Belquis Guiomar

texts.es:
La  joven Belquis Guiomar, habita en una comarca de  Managua con sus padres, ella es madre soltera con un hijo bajo su cargo, es trabajadora de una universidad privada donde se desempeña como conserje desde hace un año.

Se presento a la oficina de CEPRODEL para solicitar crédito para la comprar materiales de construcción tales como madera, cinc, bloque para poder construir un pequeño cuarto para tener mejor comodidad.

Espera con este financiamiento poder invertir poco a poco la construcción  y esperando la  oportunidad que le puedan brindarle, para poder hacer realidad unos  de sus sueños y agradece la ayuda para tener la mejor su nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Young Belquis Guiomar lives in a region of Managua with her parents. She is a single mother with a child under her care. She has worked at a private university as a caretaker for one year.
She came to the CEPRODEL office to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as wood, zinc, and blocks, in order to build a small room and have greater comfort.
